Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Hotel with Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: KTMRacing
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the Hyatt Regency on March 17, 2012 for one night. The location is excellent for Lucas Oil events. Shopping and a wide selection of eateries are a couple minutes from the hotel. The staff was helpful and polite. The rooms are clean and modern. Bathrooms are spacious. While the rooms are not spacious, the beds are comfortable enough and the view is decent. The only negative I have with the facility is the lack of above-average sound proofing. For a hotel boasting the nightly price tag the Hyatt Regency does, one would think the doors would block hall sound better. Light sleepers should take note of this. My husband is a light sleeper and suffered a poor night's sleep due to hall noise and we were at the end of the hall. The work-out facility seemed very nice with a good variety of machines and chilled towels. The pool is small but a variety of pool toys for the kiddos are made available.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany C
Reviews.Content: We just stayed one night, were in Indianapolis for the AMA Supercross Show. Hotel was amazing, everything was perfect, really nice, although for a one night stay it was $209. and parking in the parking garage is an additional $22. But it really was an awesome hotel and couldn't of been more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Overnight Stay - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: LivandMarc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for one night, Saturday, 3/17/12 while we were in town for the Supercross race at Lucas Oil Stadium. We arrived early on Saturday (around 2pm) and were promptly greeted and checked in to room 1524. Check in was simple, friendly and efficient. Room: Newly remodeled with updated furnishings, linens, etc. It was immaculately clean, the safe, keyboard, fridge, ice bucket, were all easy to find. The bed was very comfy and there were plenty of pillows, something that is rare any more. The room is equipped with TV, access to the internet, recycling bins, a fantastic desk/work station, etc. The end of the desk that faced the window had a charging station as part of the desk - hookups and charging for everything from composite cables to USB ports for charging. I travel for business and rarely see this feature - ideal for the business traveler, or those of us who travel with multiple devices. Bar: Great drink service - friendly bar tender - Patrick was a hoot! We did have to ask/remind the staff that we wanted to order food. Once the order was in it arrived quicker than expected and everyting was excellent (Pep Pizza, Turkey Clubs, Fries and salad). We were able to charge to our room or pay at time of service. We stopped back about 10:30 after the race and enjoyed a few more beverages before heading up to the room. The bar was pretty crowded and service was slow as there were only two bartenders. Restaurants: Subway, Starbucks and a Pizza/Italian Fast Food place were all open at different hours. Subway had good service and fresh food. The pizza joint wasn't open until the evening and Starbucks was open on Sunday morning but nearly out of pastries by 9:00. There are two additional, more upscale restaurants that we weren't able to try. Location: This hotel is in an ideal location for pretty much any activity downtown. The city is incredibly clean and very lively. Within a couple blocks walk any direction from the hotel were plenty of dining choices. From Steak n Shake to Ruth Cris and everything in between you would never go hungry! Walk to the stadium/convention center was 10 - 15 minutes, incredibly easy and safe. Parking: We opted to self park - $22/day. Navigating the garage was a bit of a challenge and it's not easy to get turned around when the garage is full and you hit a dead end. If you're there during peak time I would recommend Valet. The other half of our party did this for $30/day. Overall, this hotel was a great deal for an event weekend ($128/night booked through a 3rd party site) - having stayed at this hotel I would be willing to pay anywhere between my rate up to $175/$200/night. The only frustrating part of our stay were, as others have mentioned, the elevators. There were a lot of people in this hotel - between some college banquet awards, a wedding, St. Patty's guests and race guests and waiting for an elevator took some time and become increasingly frustrating as people pushed and shoved wanting to get on the next elevator. When there are fewer people, this may not be an issue - but for us it was really the only problem with our stay. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Augiethelab
Reviews.Content: This wonderful, updated Hyatt with an imposing 20 story atrium is within walking distance of everything in this very "happening" smaller city. I was visiting from Chicago and Indi seems to have everything anyone could want, except views of a big lake or big mountains. Pros: Hypoallergenic bedding: remodeled and clean rooms; nice room set-up with mini-kitchen and good desk space; located in the heart of Indi and within walking distance of a wonderful variety of restaurants, theater, symphony, museums, sporting events; indoor walkway to a large mall; staff is pleasant and helpful; nice views of the State Capitol on one side; gift shop, Starbucks, Subway and a decent workout facility with small pool and whirlpool on the first floor. Cons: Parking is an additional $22 per night and WIFI costs $9.95 per day or $39.95 for 5 days which starts to make things pricey; there can be a wait to get on an elevator if you have 300 people trying to get to the lobby at the same time (think sporting events and conferences), though we had no trouble getting an elevator 9 out of 10 times Tip: There is a revolving restaurant at the top of the Hyatt. We went up during the day to check out the view but didn't have the time to eat there. Meals seem to range from $30 to $70 per person but I found a coupon on restaurants.com so search first before you go. Also, it is possible to go for a cocktail and for me it would have been worth it to pay $10 per drink to enjoy the view, but we just didn't have the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Downtown”
Reviews.Author: liska r
Reviews.Content: Went to spend a night In downtown Indianapolis for fun. Hotel is in a great location if you want to walk to lots of restaurants, the mall, several bars, and clubs. Room was average, they have all been updated for the Super Bowl which was here last weekend. The bathroom sink looks very modern, but splashes water everywhere and makes bathroom look messy. Nice shower. Parking is $30, so be forewarned. Wifi is extra too. There is a nice little gym, indoor pool, steam shower and sauna. The hotel itself is 80's looking but rooms comfortable. The staff was very kind and helpful. If you get a good deal on Priceline (we received $50 on a Saturday night) or something, it is worth a stay, but wouldn't pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Halfway at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: MSelmi
Reviews.Content: I imagine the room conditions will improve after the current remodel. As with many Hyatt Regencies that were once palaces of modern architecture during the 70's, this one has struggled a bit to keep the ravages of time at bay. Hyatt has always ranked a notch behind Hilton & Marriott in investing in their aging properties & while the public spaces still have a modern George Jetson vibe, the rooms are showing 40 years of wear and tear. My room had peeling wallpaper in a corner, scuffs on the wall, worn, cracked caulking in the shower & dirty tile grout - things you might accept in a motel during Spring Break, but not the standard for a decent business hotel. Again, hopefully these issues will be remedied during their current renovation. The location however, is first rate, smack in the middle of the compact downtown area and easily accessible to all the main venues. There are not a large number of hotel choices in the downtown area, so If you're looking for convenience, a centralized location, full business facilities & reasonable rates, the Hyatt probably has the best location for that - Just don't expect luxury, exceptional service or a 4 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Unless you show up in fancy clothes...don't bother!!”
Reviews.Author: Shawn1981
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to take a weekend trip to Indy for the Monster Energy Supercross, we wanted a romantic getaway and decided to step it up to a 4 star hotel. We were excited to be within walking distance of the big mall and to Lucas Oil Stadium for the race. I have a chronic pain disorder and sometimes have to use a cane to help me along. After walking all day due to exploring downtown and the race....we decided to stop in the hotel bar for a cold drink. The place was hopping with people drinking and having a good time, most of them casually dressed in button down shirts, slacks or dresses. My wife and I had just come from the race in jeans and hooded sweatshirts (mind you we paid $200.00 a night for a room just as everyone else) I took a seat due to my hip bothering me, my wife continued to the bar. I watched her wait for 20 minutes, with no line in front of her stand at the bar and be completely invisible to the bartender. I went over to her and said "let's go to bed". On the way up I stopped by the front desk to give a piece of my mind and was not even apologized to. Someone needs to tell these people the old saying don't judge a book by it's cover because my wife and I had a pocket full of money that we would have gladly sat and spent on cocktails if they weren't ignorant enough to ignore us because we weren't dressed like the rest of the "Hoi Poloi" in the lounge that night. Lousy service, room was ok but I've stayed in WAY better for less than $200.00 bucks a nite. Long walk from the parking deck to the hotel. Rude staff, will NEVER go back!!

Reviews.Title: “EXEXCISE ROOMS ARE IMPORTANT”
Reviews.Author: Duffy088
Reviews.Content: The management at the Hyatt in Indy need to be aware that exercise rooms are an important element for the business traveller and need daily maintenance. On Wednesday, towels, water and anti bacterial wipes. Thursday, no water, no anti bacterial wipes. On Friday, no water, no towels or anti bacterial wipes. Very dissappointing from the Hyatt chain.....which should be a cut above the norm.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: flamingoette
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze, lobby area is great offering starbucks and subway along with other restaurants and cafe and small bar. Hallways are open to the large building so there is not that stuffy feeling. Corner room was spacious, everything was neat and clean. Bed and pillows were most comfy. Conveniently located to everything in this fun little city. Had a great weekend, highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 911RN
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great downtown location, you can walk almost anywhere downtown if you choose. We booked this room thru Priceline 1 day prior to our visit. We self parked in the underground garage for $22, which was the going rate at most area garages. Check in was flawless. The entire hotel was modern and clean. The 4 elevators were fast enough, we never waited more than 1 minute for one to arrive. Our room was clean with a great view of the city. The beds were a bit small, not really suitable for 2 people and the sheets were a little rough for my taste. I never noticed any construction noise, but did see workers in the building. The hotel is connected to the Circle Centre Mall, which was a bonus. There is a Subway, Pizza place and another small resturant in the lobby. I would not recommend the hotel resturant for breakfast as the prices were high, $26 for 1 childs breakfast, coffee and a chorizo burrito.

Reviews.Title: “Nice remodel”
Reviews.Author: homeykat
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Hyatt, but not since the remodel. The rooms have new furnishings and the bathrooms have also been redone. The bed was very comfortable. I enjoyed the new look of the rooms and hallways. We stayed here for a cheer competition, we were on the 18th floor, and the elevator situation was never horrible. The room has a mini fridge and coffee maker. We needed to stay another night and the staff was very accommodating about letting us stay in the same room, even though it was supposed to come off the market for maintenance. Billy at the front desk was wonderful. The rooms are quiet, I never heard any noise from our neighbors or the kids staying at the hotel. The lobby is comfortable and there are fast food as well as a full service restaurant on site. There are many restaurants within a block of the hotel. I loved that the hotel was connected to the convention center and the mall. It was great to not have to drag our coats around.

Reviews.Title: “Good Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Greg O
Reviews.Content: We stayed this past weekend for a national cheerleading competition. I would like to compliment the entire staff on making attempts to make sure we were satisified. Yes, the elevators are slow, but the staff noticed I had given up waiting and started towards the stairs when a maintenance person instead asked that I follow him to an employee elevator. They do charge for wireless connection, but I had two computers and although the charge would normally be for each computer the front desk clerk offered to refund the charge for one of the computers. The valet service asked if I had a good stay and liked the remodeled rooms. Yes, they are very nice. Housekeeping did a nice job of cleaning the room. So bottom line, I appreciate that the folks that are working at the hotel clearly tried to make sure my stay was pleasant. P.S. The rooms are all remodeled and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rusty0707
Reviews.Content: We did book this hotel though priceline and got the hotel for for under 50 dollars. Cant complain about that. Parking was 22.00, little high. But overall Within blocks to tons of restaurants. There was a little construction going on at the hotel, but did not bother us too much. It did look like this will soon be conected the the big mall downtown, that construction looked like it was going to be complete soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to stay at, but ridiculous extra costs.”
Reviews.Author: Eric R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very beautiful and a great place to stay, at Priceline prices. If not for priceline, I would never stay at a hotel like this. Even though it is a great hotel, the fact that parking is $30 a night and they charge for Wi-Fi, where every place in America has free wi-fi (starbucks, panera, gyms, malls, etc) shows that this company is just out to rip off there customers. I got the hotel room for $47 (plus tax). So for me, it was still a great deal. But out of principal, to have to pay $30 a night for parking when you are a guest is like going to a restaurant and then charging you extra to sit down at your dinner table. I have learned over my 7 years of using Priceline that the higher the star rating, the more you are charged for stuff you get for free at lower star hotels. Example, 2.5 star you get free breakfast, free Wi-Fi, free parking, etc. 4.0 star you pay for parking, breakfast and wi-fi. I bet at a 5 star, you have to put quarters in to get toilet paper. The main difference in the starts is the lobby area. The best room I ever stayed in was a 2.5 star Wingate hotel. In conclusion, the hotel really is beautiful, convenient, and a great place to stay, but they nickel and dime you for everything and unless people complain about it, they will never change. Or maybe everyone just has money to burn, were I do not.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location!”
Reviews.Author: Mike J
Reviews.Content: Great location, will be nicer when renovation is complete.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Lingenator
Reviews.Content: Likes Comfortable hotel Great location in downtown Indy Walkways connecting you with area attractions Dislikes Room was way too hot on 1st night, but management fixed it Breakfast was pricey for a family of 5

Reviews.Title: “Must Be Shills”
Reviews.Author: SouthernMan111
Reviews.Content: I'm amazed at all the good reviews for this hotel. After a recent bad experience here, I feel obligated to balance the scales a bit. I’ve stayed here twice and won't be back. The first time I stayed (last year), the front desk person was impersonal and disinterested. I'm a Diamond Gold Passport member, but received none of the personal attention or recognition I have come to expect from (and have received at) other Hyatt properties. I even had to ask for my Diamond amenity - that was a first for me. The young man behind the counter seemed put out that he had to do the minor paperwork required for that - and when the amenity finally arrived, the fruit provided was green and ineditble. I ended up throwing it away. Upstairs, the room was still dirty when we arrived and we had no towels. We were leaving to meet some friends, so we just called the front desk and requested service. When we got back 2 hours later, the room had still not been cleaned. In all it took over 3 hours to get housekeeping up to our room to finish cleaning it and supplying us with towels. The service in the restaurant at breakfast the next day was very slow. There was one waiter trying to service too many tables, and he appeared to be more concerned with something in the kitchen than providing service anyway. The food was mediocre at best. We were talking with some of the other people in the dining room (we all had plenty of time to kill) and they all had similar horror stories regarding their stays. The crappy elevators probably don't need any more comment, but here goes. They do take forever, which is amazing since the doors snap open and closed in a couple of seconds when they do finally arrive. If you are hypnotized from the long wait (and it's almost impossible NOT to be), and you do not immediately jump into the car, you can easily miss it and have to start your wait all over again. Considering how expensive this hotel is, and the fact that it is a Hyatt property, we expected much better. On subsequent visits to Indianapolis, we have opted for the Mariott complex just up the street, and we have been very satisfied there. Last month, however, we were meeting friends at a restaurant directly across the street from the Hyatt for our anniversary. To avoid having to rent a car, we opted to stay at the Hyatt again. What a mistake! We reserved a King size bed and asked for a low floor (to avoid having to use the elevator). Once again, I received no recognition of my Diamond GP status, until I pointed it out to the desk clerk. This time he offered the amenity, but, remembering the poor quality of the edible (or inedible) amenity on the previous visit, I opted for the GP points. The gentleman behind the counter unapologetically told us our room was on a high floor. When we got to our room, we found we had been assigned a room with two double beds! Not double Queens, double beds! The carpet was worn and stained, the TV screen was filthy and one of the lamps had a burned out bulb. When I complained to the front desk and requested the King size bed room we had reserved, I was told there were none available. My wife and I ended up having to sleep in separate beds on our anniversary! Back at the front desk, we were given a song and dance about how the room type is subject to availability and the young man whined about how they were under renovation. As if his excuses would matter to me! I even had to remind the gentleman that I was entitled to additional Gold Passport points since they were unable to accommodate me. He seemed annoyed that I kept referring to my Gold Passport membership. When I checked my account a couple of days later, neither the amenity points nor the bonus points were on the stay. I had to call customer service to get the bonuses. Needless to say, I have learned my lesson. One bad stay might be an anomaly, but two is a trend. Given that 100% of my experience with this hotel has been bad, I can only assume that all these positive reviews are being posted by shills for the hotel. Maybe the employees get a little something something for going online and providing positive feedback? We’ll be staying at the Mariott in the future.

Reviews.Title: “renovation will improve hotel”
Reviews.Author: dnpinva
Reviews.Content: I don't believe it is fair to review this hotel with anything less than 4-stars, given the exceptional price I was able to get in priceline. It's a nice hotel, but it needs to be renovated. Luckily, the hotel is undergoing a massive renovation which promises much needed upgrades in each of the rooms. The hotel lobby is very nice and inviting. The rooms are clean. The TVs are quite large but did not appear to be in HD, and the channels were somewhat limited. The bathroom was plain. The shower head was not satisfying, with low-to-moderate water pressure. The light fixtures in the bathroom and main room were dated and need to be changed. There was a charge for wifi, but it was fairly fast. Also note, there is a charge for parking ($22 for self park or $30 for valet). The location is very good right in downtown and with easy access to the highway heading to the airport. The workout room was under construction, but it appeared to be ok. The staff were terrific. I think this hotel will be a strong 4-star hotel following renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location”
Reviews.Author: gmbc76
Reviews.Content: For a convention this place is the best. Lots of places to eat and drink and you can walk the skywalk to the convention center. Service is great and room was clean. Starbucks and subway downstairs. Good for business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Under some renovation but will stay again on my next trip”
Reviews.Author: dhyland
Reviews.Content: Great location. The updated rooms are very nice. Stay on 18th floor and get access to the regency club for yummy breakfast and evening goodies. Hotel is undergoing some updates.

Reviews.Title: “Hope you like construction noise”
Reviews.Author: neurodoc01
Reviews.Content: Clean, nicely appointed room. Seemed they were lacking staff at check in. Lots of noise in room from hotel construction.

Reviews.Title: “There are so many great places to stay in Indy... Stay away from Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler486
Reviews.Content: I had the rudest experience the last time I checked in. I left the hotel and stayed elsewhere. Will never stay again. Stay at the JW Marriott they are what service is ALL ABOUT. Very slow wireless internet. Loud construction noise very early in the morning. Elevators Slow and anoying. Hotel very dated and not worth the money. Conciere floor a joke. Well maybe if you think a few pieces of cheese and crackers and gross deserts is a way to reward frequent guests. RUDE staff. Stay AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Management”
Reviews.Author: produce592
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled to stay at this hotel from 10/29 to 11/1 while I attended a conference. Kelsey, a young lady, checked me in. I was assigned to Room 902. Upon entering, I noticed that it was one of those adjoining rooms separated by a door. I immediately went back down and told Kelsey that I was not comfortable being in that type of room, so she gave me Room 816. As I was walking down the hall to room 816, I observed a group of high school (or college?) students running up and down the hall, being loud and boisterous, and they went into the room right next to where I would be staying. I felt that Kelsey put me in this room next to the rowdy students out of spite because I complained about not being comfortable with the first room. I went down to the front desk yet again. This time I spoke with Nick, a young manager. He was insistent that he could not accommodate me any further, so I asked him to cancel my reservation and that I would go next door to the Westin. As of yesterday (10/29) my bank account is still showing Hyatt Regency charges, but I will be sure to keep a close eye on this situation. While I cannot rate this hotel per se, because I did not stay there, I do want to comment on the hotel's design. The interior hallways overlook the lobby. There is only about a 3 foot railing, certainly not enough to keep some young reveler (or drunkard) from falling many, many stories to their deaths, landing on the lobby floor It is very scary, a very poor design. I might be willing to try another Hyatt Regency at some point but certainly not this one in Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not for the price.”
Reviews.Author: BadRat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency Indianapolis Oct. 15 & 16, 2011. The hotel is going through a top to bottom renovation. The top four floors are finished and floors 16-12 are closed for renovation at this time. We stayed on the 11th floor while some friends stayed on the "new" 20th floor. Our old room was still nice and clean, spacious and comfortable. There was no real control of the room temperature, only the fan. (We like to sleep at 65, not happenening here.) The tub / shower was nice. There is no vent fan in the bathroom. The rooms are all adjoining and at 8:30am someone from the room connected to ours tried very hard to come into our room. This woke me from what was otherwise a very good nights sleep. The bed was comfortable and sheets nice with a high thread count. The room had a large flat screen TV with a fair number of channels. Our friend's "new" room only had a walk-in shower, no tub. The power went out to half their room, and there was no phone service. I guess they still have to work out the bugs. Overall the hotel was nice and clean with an excellent location. Downtown Indianapolis is beautiful with lots of shops and restaurants. Be forewarned, there is a bunch of major construction going on on several streets downtown. A lot of detours and closed sidewalks. It will be really nice when all the construction is finished for the Super Bowl. There are numerous nice hotels downtown and I'd compare prices. The Hyatt was pricy for what we got, but the wedding reception we attended was held in one of the hotel ballrooms. I will say the food served at the reception was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jeff8210
Reviews.Content: Recently attended large conference at Indy Convention Center. I personally stayed on the 13th floor The staff at the hotel was terrific. They have quick food solutions in the lobby for those on the go (Subway sandwich shop). They also have a great lounge on the top floor called the "Eagles Nest". Great place to see the city lights. There is direct interior access to the convention center via the sky bridge so you can get from the hotel to your meetings no matter the weather conditions. So all and all for business travel the Hyatt in Downtown Indy is a Home-run!!

Reviews.Title: “Old, needs a facelift (coming), decent but not what expected of $250+/night. Bathrooms need attention.”
Reviews.Author: hodels
Reviews.Content: The overall cleanliness seemed OK in the room itself; but the bathrooms are in GREAT need of attention.......a bit on the gross side. The ceiling in the bathroom was the worst, I had to force myself to not look up. The floor of the tub was pretty bad, and fortunately they provided a rubber mat (which was in good condition, thank goodness). The rest of the room seemed fine. Beds and linens were clean. Looks like they updated the wardrobe/closet & coffee area in the past 5 years as these were relatively modern and seemed newer than the rest of the room. Carpets appeared OK, no big stains or anything that seemed unclean. The hotel is beginning some massive renovation project, starting with the top/22nd floor & working it's way down. So there is hope! The lobby & bar areas are very nice, clean, and modern in style. Staff, again, was great in all areas. Elevators are slow when there are conventions in town. If you ask for a lower floor you have better luck in getting up & down quicker (floor 5 is the lowest with rooms). There is a Starbucks in the lobby, along with a Subway & Pizza place. Very convenient & a big bonus! Starbucks is only open from 6am - 12 noon each day though, so when you need that 3pm pick-me-up it's hotel coffee.....there are other hotels nearby with Starbucks inside the lobby as well & they are usually open later. JW Marriott has a very large Starbucks with seating areas all around. All the hotels in the block are connected to the convention center via covered/inside walkways. It is oftena longer walk than going outside, but the option is there for rainy days - also nice if you are a lady with kong hair & want to avoid humidity & such before a long day in a convention booth! Lot's of places to eat & drink in downtown Indy, so the need for a car can be skipped if you have transport to/from the airport. Shuttles can take 30 min for transport, and the indy airport seems pretty good for security, during a large convention we made it through security in less than 10 min (would have been OK to arriv 1hour before flight, we arrived with 2 hr & had time to eat).

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CRMays
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt has everything. I am a "hotel diva" - meaning I am very particular about hotels. The rooms at this Hyatt are spacious and clean. The hotel has a great ambience with it's open atrium, waterfalls, nice decor and really good restraunts. O/S is great for lunch! It also has Starbucks, Subway, a pizza shop, and other stores. It right in the heart of downtown Indy where there is so much to do. It is also across the street and connected through skywalks to Circle Center Mall. You can't go wrong. I stayed there part time by myself and part of the time with my family during the Final Four.

Reviews.Title: “They take care of you”
Reviews.Author: chernobog1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week. No one in the hotel was anything less than the best. Close to many great restaurants and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel not suitable for large conferences”
Reviews.Author: lovinbirds
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean and the staff were professional and kind. The only problem is that the hotel is not set up for large conferences. Sometimes, I waited over thirty minutes for the elevator due to so many people going up and down. The food was really good and I was amazed that it always came out hot considering that there were so many people to serve at once. There was a problem with our first room and the staff offered to move us. We packed and moved ourselves and they gave us free wifi for our trouble. Take your own bottled water. If remember correctly, it was $3 a bottle.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel for convnetions”
Reviews.Author: AChilean
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a large no-frills convention hotel well located downtown, next to Circle mall. There are a number of good restaurants nearby. The rooms are standard quality. One high point is the revolving restaurant on the roof. One thing that did not impress me was the staff's attitude. Black Expo was held during the time I was there, and the staff was extremely anxious. The hotel handed out bracelets that had to be worn when entering after 7 pm. To test this, I entered after 8, with my bracelet out of sight in my pocket. The guards didn't ask to see my bracelet at all, while black guests were asked for theirs (I'm white). A disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but could use some work”
Reviews.Author: PLM2534
Reviews.Content: Great location right in the middle of the action. Parking was reasonable (if you dont want to pay $30 than stay out in the cornfields). Beautiful lobby with amazing views from the elevator. Staff was super friendly also. Not enough elevators for the amount of rooms. Room showed it's age as they need to replace the worn carpet and peeling wall paper. Housekeeping needs to be coached as the room wasn't cleaned properly upon arrival but hey, I got the room off Priceline so I am not complaining at all.

Reviews.Title: “Slow elevators! Way tooo slow!”
Reviews.Author: panther61
Reviews.Content: I am usually not too critical but I stayed at this property to attend a convention located within the hotel. Convention management and planning was fine. I will list the good and bad points of the property for your consideration: Good: Location! Valet parking Front desk Lobby located in PNC building which had Subway, Starbucks and an ATM. My room was quiet Bad: Slow internet and $9.95 perday Elevators - Maybe it was the convention or the upcoming NASCAR race but it was torture having to wait for the elevator almost every time during my two night stay. Many times the elevator would arrive and would be full so you had to let it go and wait more! One elevator out of the four were out and it did not look like they were working on it at all. This was a big inconvenience! Ironing board was unable to stand up on it's legs AC was just so so and would not go lower than 68. I realize 2 stars is a poor review but the management has to do something about the elevators at once! 10 minutes is way too long!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for conventions!”
Reviews.Author: dentalgal
Reviews.Content: As a chairman for a convention for the philanthropic sorority I belong to, we chose the Hyatt Regency, Downtown Indy for our convention location over 5 years ago. What a great choice! We were so pleased at the outcome for our nearly 500 attendees! What a great place for a convention or conference. Tracy Weed is the best convention services manager out there- and she lead us through the process, gave us great ideas and treated us grand! Thanks to Tracy, Melissa, Abdell, Tina, Jeff, Billy and countless others that made our convention one of the best ever! The guest rooms were so comfortable, quiet, clean and accomodating! THANK YOU Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant but hard to find!”
Reviews.Author: Iris981
Reviews.Content: We were thrown off at first by ZERO signs leading to their "main entrance" as we circled the block twice. We saw signs for a parking garage, but planned to do Valet parking. FYI, it's IN the parking garage as is their lobby entrance. We heard several other people complain about that as well. Beyond that, everything was great! There are kiosks in the lobby where you can check in if you've booked with your credit card - that was fabulous as there was a long line at the desk to check in with a host. It printed our room keys and a map right there at the kiosk! WOW! The room was really nice with a great view and we had the 'standard' room. We were there for a wedding reception and it was beautifully done. The only other thing I would say is the rotating restaurant cost $55.00 per person for a buffet - No buffet is worth that much! And the cost to park was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: timzmail
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt turned out to be quite a nice hotel. We were initially put in a room with two doubles and it seemed rather small but after contacting the front desk a bellman escorted us to a different room and it was lovely. A corner room with a king bed and amazing view of the capital buiding. Each request was handled just as promptly and the staff couldn't have been more courteous. The room was very clean (and this was the most important thing for us) and the only down side was the furnishings had some wear. Nothing major tho. The bathroom was spotless and the shower a generous size. We did not use room service so can't comment on that but we did inquire as to where a good pizza place might be and we were given a list along with their personal favorites. The Hyatt is within walking distance of several restaurants, the mall, canal and stadiums. Overall we have absolutely no complaints and would recommend this hotel. We have stayed at the Westin and liked this just as well. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Volleyballa
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel! The best part about the hotel is the location! It is within walking distance of everything,which is a good thing! Rooms were very clean, workout facility was amazing! One of the nicest workout facilities I have seen in a hotel! The blowdryer in the room didn't work very well, and parking is $22 per day! That is RIDICULOUS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMC062
Reviews.Content: It has the basics; the room was clean and big enough. The hotel is connected to the mall downtown via skybridge so that is convenient to get to restaurants especially if the weather is bad outside. There is a Starbucks in the lobby downstairs but it closes early in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend.”
Reviews.Author: mesoftball
Reviews.Content: I have never done a hotel review for my boss, but I recently booked this hotel who does frequent conference traveling. She is not picky, but reported this hotel was not a pleasant experience. The furniture and bedding was worn and she did not have a comfortable stay. She recommended the Westin next time she's in Indiannapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: dalejrgirl
Reviews.Content: With the reviews on here I was a little nervous about our stay here. But, we found the Hyatt to be a great location, our room was spacious and clean. The bed was VERY comfortable and we loved our view of downtown. The TV was a great size and we thought it had a lot of channels. The shower was hot and had plenty of pressure. We truly couldn't find anything to be negative about(except the cost of parking). We will be back! Thanks Hyatt and Indy for a great birthday! :)

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else: service is very bad”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraJ13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights while in Indy on business. There are many other hotels in the downtown area, so I advise people to stay elsewhere, as the staff here, while very nice, is inept. We initially reseved two nights, then added Wed night to the reservation a few days before arriving. As a result, it took the staff 20 minutes or more to check my husband in: adding that one night (at a different rate) was just too confusing for them. We arranged for a late departure, got to our room only to learn that we were locked out: the hotel had not processed the late stay arrangement. That took 20 minutes or more to get fixed. We were to be given complementary parking; on leaving, that also took even more time and required us to track down the organizer of our event, required her to track down the parking manager, and even then it took the staff lots of time to figure out how to get the computer to deduct the charge. Not exactly a speedy departure. The upkeep was also not good. The floor outside the elevator on our floor was not vacuumed for the entire time we were there (popcorn or peanut pieces all over). The towel dispensers in the restrooms for the conference attendees were not all refilled. The service in the hotel restaurant was also bad, the food for one diner arriving after everyone else had almost finished, despite repeated requests for it. (it was soup - hardly the item that takes a lot of time to get.) We also felt overcharged for things. My husband was charged $30 for a room service sandwich that cost $11 in the restaurant. The fact that they charged for wifi access just added to our displeasure. Stay somewhere else, these people mean well but they don't know how to run a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this property except for parking!”
Reviews.Author: rubyiu
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! This Hyatt definitely has it. There are other hotels in the area too, but this one is great! I stayed here for a conference, so I also had the experience of being in the ballroom and several meeting rooms. My first impression was from finding how to check in from driving in. I pulled into the driveway and the valet told me to park in the garage under the building. It was the weirdest layout of any parking garage I've ever seen - like a maze with haphazard spots everywhere. It was a little confusing to navigate, but I got a spot close to the elevators with ease, once I found them! When I checked in, there was a person helping direct people to open front desk employees. The employee who helped me was very nice and honored my request to have a room without an adjoining door - I'm a light sleeper and those doors always make you hear the person next to you! I got a room that was down a hall, away from the elevators and the atrium. When I walked in, the set up was a little different than other Hyatts I've been to but it was nice! Big bed, desk, chair, TV, and decent sized bathroom. Maybe a little smaller than a normal Hyatt but still roomy enough. I was also pleasantly surprised to find a mini fridge in my room. My room was really quiet and I slept so well! I brought my white noise maker because I always sleep with it. I heard some traffic from outside but not much. What do you expect - you want to stay downtown, you are going to hear it. The meeting rooms were nice and the employees kept them clean and well stocked with water, paper and pens (and without trash) in between meetings. The ballroom was nice and the temperature was good there. Some rooms got a little hot or cold but it happens. I love that they had a pizza place, Subway, and Starbucks in the lobby, as well as a bar and restaurant. Very convenient for someone on a tight schedule. They also have a large gift shop with all sorts of stuff - except of course, what I needed! No stamps, and no books or magazines. Bummer on that. The skywalk to Circle Centre Mall was so awesome - it was really quick and easy to go shop or eat there. There are also a huge amount of eateries within close walking distance. I arrived at 4:30pm on Thursday and left at 5:30pm on Saturday. When I left the parking garage, I paid $50 (!!!!!!!!) for the privilege of parking there. Holy crap! That is awful- DO NOT drive here if you can help it! Wifi is also super expensive - I used my smart phone instead of laptop. There are several area businesses that offer it for free though, so go to Steak n' Shake or somewhere else for free wifi. Other than the parking thing, I would highly recommend this Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect”
Reviews.Author: JoanneDavies
Reviews.Content: A huge complex hotel. Large, clean modern rooms. Good desks for business travellers - but no free internet access. Breakfast is OK and there are a number of outlets in the hotel, if you don't want to pay hotel prices to eat. No safe in the room, which is an oversight in my opinion and silly things like no glasses for rinsing mouth when cleaning teeth

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average stay...cant believe this is a Hyatt property”
Reviews.Author: tinamagill
Reviews.Content: Location is in the center of downtown. Shops, Bars and Restaurants are just outside. Rooms are average, not like any other hyatt I've encountered. Bathrooms need renovation. Staff are not very helpful...we were looking for a spa and they had no suggestions. We asked for directions, we were given wrong directions. ALso I put the do not disturb sign up and a man just walked in my room when I was getting out of the shower. Valet staff are nice. Should be a holiday inn.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Elevators, but that is it!”
Reviews.Author: blakestravel
Reviews.Content: COLD UNINVITING ATMOSPHERE. Not all about customer service like most hotels. Bad news first. I stayed in one of the Capitol View rooms. The room was on the corner of the hotel, and was not too spacious. The coffee did not taste to good, and I had to go all the way down to One South to get some cream or milk for my coffee. My grandmother and I decided to just get starbucks in the hotel. Then our toilet broke, and the handle would not flush the toilet. We had to take the lid off and lift the chain until it was fixed the next day as we requested. There was another important aspect of this hotel. I do not get to stay in hotels very often, so I come to a hotel to enjoy the atmosphere of a hotel. The Hyatt seems like an apartment building. It is just so big and half of the building is an office building. The atmosphere is one of an office building. It is hard to describe, but it just seemed so cold in the Hyatt and the customer service seemed pretty unwilling to say anything to you such as Good Morning or something like that unless you talked to them first. Now I am going to start on the elevators. I come from Evansville, small city. I do not get the opportunity to ride such fast and nice elevators very often. These are the nicest elevators in any of the hotels I have been inside of in Indy. There is a 20-story atrium and the elevators look down on them. They are fast and the view they provide is absolutely amazing! (Glass elevators)

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, Dirty Bathroom, Front Desk fail to served”
Reviews.Author: AlbertoRivera
Reviews.Content: check inn fast,,1st. night not bad, next morning going to the bathroom the shower dairy, to toilet not working well, 2nd. night well people running outside room, shouting I need to call front desk 3 times it took one hour to fix the outside problems, The morning restaurant, and valet parking very good, A the end I asked for my bill and they didn't apply my payment made through hotel.com I need to show them a copy of my printed reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DallasGatr
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Hyatt many times over the years. Very pretty and elegant. About as good a workout room as you get in a hotel. Nice, clean rooms. Very close and indoor walk to the mall. Good bar.

Reviews.Title: “We left it was so bad”
Reviews.Author: jgflys
Reviews.Content: Well my gal booked this place as a pre v-day getaway for just us to be alone. Upon arrival everything seemed great. The valet was very nice but when we got up to the room it became a different story real quick. The room was filthy, The bed looked like it was layed in, the floors were dirty and the bathroom was still dirty from the previous guest. The ottoman had a huge stain on it that was just vile. So we went down and asked for a new room. We looked at 2 other rooms which included the best room they had to offer and all the same filth everytime. In there top room there was still blue painters tape left on the walls where they stopped painting. Come on really. Now I understand its a 4 star hotel but its not a one star. So we asked for our money back., The front desk was very understanding and courteous. We ended up staying at the Omni hotel that night and were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “accommodating”
Reviews.Author: homeykat
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hyatt in years past. We travel to Indy frequently for cheer competitions. We stayed at another hotel, and bad weather came in so we needed to stay another night. I went to the Hyatt and they were accommodating to get me in a room for the best possible price. We were with some of my daughter's friends and asked for the same floor, I was disappointed that we didn't get the same floor or an explanation as to why we didn't get the same floor. The room was dusty, but otherwise clean. I mentioned it at checkout and the gentleman at the desk offered me Starbucks for the inconvenience, which I appreciated. Because of the layout of the hotel, it can be noisy and the elevators can take awhile if there is an event with a lot of kids, like the cheer competition.

Reviews.Title: “Room nightmare”
Reviews.Author: JuciyTravelLover
Reviews.Content: When I stayed at the Hyatt I was excepting an amazing, high class experience, but the key word in that sentence was expecting because that is NOT what I got at all! We had 3 different rooms in 24hrs! It was ridiculous in in two rooms the heat was not working (in December) and in one of them the toilet was leaking! This is a far cry from the 4 star hotel that I read about online.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, Quiet rooms, Good workout facility.”
Reviews.Author: nolazona
Reviews.Content: I have to travel to Indy every few months for work. I've stayed at a few different hotels, but like the Hyatt the best. The service is very good - even when I arrive very late at night. My room has always been very clean. My big complaint about most hotels in a downtown area is noise from the street etc., but this hotel is very quiet, which is fantastic because all I really want when I'm business travelling is a clean, comfy bed, food within walking distance, a good workout room, and good service. The Hyatt has all of these things. My only complaint at all is I wish they would give you free wireless internet and that there was a better business center, but overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: korokoro
Reviews.Content: This is just an awful hotel. It's difficult to know where to start. Too few, too slow lifts. Internet that doesn't work properly,. Expensive food of very average quality. Noisy rooms. An unstaffed business centre that didn't have any paper for the printers and copiers. Oh I could go on and on. The staff try their best to overcome what clearly is a design and management crash site - but it is an uphill task.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Stay--Agonizing Elevators”
Reviews.Author: demiijohn
Reviews.Content: Big hotels in big cities generally feel the same to me. Unless you're really upgrading to a luxury hotel or unless one is incredibly poorly run, you seem to get the same experience. So it tends to be the little things that stand out. In Indianapolis, it was the elevators. Or lack thereof. Because I was at a conference in the hotel I was up and down to my room a bit, and these were the SLOWEST elevators and there were only four. Not enough to accommodate everyone when it was busy. So I took the stairs quite a bit. It didn't ruin my stay, but it was a nuisance. Otherwise excellent location downtown--could get out and walk--and I thought the food and service in the ballroom was all quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: pachocolate1
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently at Hyatt and had a bad experience. Went to check in and was told that my room was being used and the person would be not checking out for a couple of hours and then my room would be ready. I have never had this happen to me before. I marked late arrival and they took the chance that I would not be there until very late and booked my room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: RetirednurseIndiana
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 2 nights with a friend for a conference. I can't say enough about how nice it was. The rooms were very clean and pretty, the staff was great...Our guest room had a great view overlooking the Capitol building downtown Indy. The beds were very plush and comfortable. Everyone I talked to from the check in staff and bellmen, to the waiters and waitresses and housekeeping were genuinely friendly and helpful. The conference rooms were very nice.. Icewater in every room and refreshed often...pens and pads if desired. We had everything we needed and the event planners and banquet managers went overboard to make our stay and our conference good. Lots of choices for meeting rooms and good suggestions from the staff on the set up of the rooms and the vendor spaces.. Parking was pricey but probably in line with the other downtown hotels. The food was good too. Every meal we had there was great. And the 2 or 3 lunches in The ONE South restaurant was great...wonderful pasta bar!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: irish2171
Reviews.Content: Went up to Indy for a overnight getaway. Check in was a breeze, place was clean, neat, updated. Valet was pricey..........but when isn't it? Got a great deal with my AAA card. Capitol View on 11th floor for $89 including breakfast for two. Hotel restaurant for breakfast was a tad slow on keeping food stocked, but no big deal. Location is ideal for downtown anything. If I had to name one thing I would change it would be to update the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “great location, seasoned hotel”
Reviews.Author: cpdr1
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during the Motogp weekend. Pros: Location was perfect- A block or two from the action (Sturgis at Indy, the mall, etc). Staff was very friendly- That Friday check in was smooth- waited in line maybe 2 min. Someone even offered us water while we waited. Mgmt had that part covered (they must've read one of the views below). The weight room was good- they had every body part covered. The room was very clean besides a couple of minor things. Cons: as others have mentioned this hotel seemed old and weathered. The room we stayed in had this little table that should've been replaced- water damage made it look filthy. We just put that table in the corner of the room out of our site. The window was a little dirty. The room and the pool were small but did the job. Other than these minor things the hotel was very good. Not a bad price for a decent downtown hotel. Suggestion: I know Vegas hotels and other big cities charge for wifi but is it that much more to please the guests? Might try another hotel next year but won't keep it off the list of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: phillyphlyer40
Reviews.Content: Had a one-night stay while on business in Indy. This is NOT one of the top, or even middle-of-the-road Hyatt's. Room was ok-A/C worked well, but the fan made a clunking noise all night long. Woke a few times from it, but not a major problem. No Regency Club-major disappointment.-mngt said they will have one shortly, it is being remodeled. (didnt help me when I stayed) Business center is outsourced, and with no club, no where for a Diamond member to print a simple word document for free-not sure of the pricing as I waited until my next day's stay at the Westin to print.-mngt said they were ordering pre-paid cards to give to Diamonds, but not there yet. (again, didnt help me!) Gym was typical Hyatt, but very small compared to other Hyatts. Overall, with so many great choices in Indy, it is hard to justify staying at the HR Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location - but prepare to sweat in your room”
Reviews.Author: Telemacchus
Reviews.Content: This past weekend I spent a beautiful but hot sticky time in Kentucky and Indianapolis. It was VERY humid outside. The group I was with was very overheated and dehydrated from being outdoors all afternoon in the sun, and so it was with much anticipated temperature relief that we all checked into our rooms at the Hyatt Regency Capitol. The hotel was great, by the way; spotless, friendly, and reasonably priced with modern accommodations everywhere - super location too. Once in my room, I couldn't get cool enough fast enough - but unfortunately, found out I was doomed to stay that way. Opening the door to my room I expected a comforting wall of moving cool air when I stepped in. Instead I was hit with a wall of static warm stuffy air. Grrr - hate that. Most frustrating of all, I found myself stuck with one of those ridiculous placebo thermostats, you know, the kind that lets you think you're changing the temperature, but you never really do. It's the HVAC equivalent of a sugar pill. It was a fully modern, new high-tech thermostat, and it appeared you could dial any temperature range you wanted. The thermostat accepted my inputs for a temp in the 60's or even 50's, but the room temp never budged from 72.8 - period. Nothing I could do would actually chill down the room. Now 72.8 is fine for the elderly and 98 pound stick-people who always complain about the cold from the slightest puff of breeze, but us grown men who are not iron-deficient from farther northern parts need some real meat-locker style air conditioning on a hot day when it's 95 outside once in awhile. Why can't each person in each hotel room truly always have full temperature control, on demand. All the rooms my buddies were in were the same way, and they were really peeved too. When thermostats are rigged like this it is extremely annoying, because they appear to let you have more control than you do, so why can't the hotel just be honest about it. Either disable them, remove them, or put a sticker on there that states the system is rigged for a certain temperature. Then, say that on your website. So I know not to stay there. I would most definitely stay there again, just not in the summer. I'm sure the whole chintzy air conditioning thing was some sort of cost-saving least-people-complain setting, and probably hiding under a green label. It marred an otherwise extremely nice stay. Guests need to produce gobs of meat-locker style air conditioning on hot August days. Fix this.

Reviews.Title: “Better than some, but not a great Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: PJGerace
Reviews.Content: Over the last decade of traveling for business I've stayed at about 20 different Hyatts across the country, so I'm kind of comparing this one to the others. I travel to Indy once or twice a year and stay there because I'm a Hyatt platinum member. The Hyatt in Indy is convenient to downtown and that''s a big plus. About two years ago, they did a lobby remodel and added a bar and new restaurant, which are nice, but didn't do much for the rooms. Frankly for what they charge, its time to cough up the bucks and do a sincere remodel on the rooms. They're slightly below average and year after year they promise to do more, but don't. Great restaurant on top of the hotel that gives a 360 degree view of the city AND has great food! If I wasn't so loyal to Hyatt, I'd probably pick another hotel downtown because of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't impressed”
Reviews.Author: babygyrl_boo
Reviews.Content: I was unpleasantly surprised with my stay at the Hyatt. When I approached the front desk, I had to stand there almost fifteen minutes before anyone would even acknowledge I was there to check in. There were approximately six people working the desk, but onl three were with other guests. I checked in around 6pm on a Saturday evening. I informed them that I had decided to add a second day with a second confirmation number. He made it sound as if he he took care of it in their system. The room itself was clean. I did not have a view, but for the amount I paid, I really wasn't expecting one. The numbers in their phone directory were not correct. I called the number they listed for Valet and found it was for Housekeeping. They told me I had to call the front desk to have the valet get my car. They did not clean the toilet very well under the rim, and there were mold spots in the restroom. The picture of the pool makes it appear as if it could be a full size pool. The pool was small considering the size and price of the hotel. It was so crowded that it was basically just standing around in the pool as no one could really swim. All of the computers in the business center had notes taped on them stating the computers and printers were not working. On day two, my room key stopped working so I had to go get a new key. I called the front desk for the valet to get my car ready, but did not receive an answer. When I went to check out, there was only ONE person working the front desk at 11am on Monday. There was a line of a dozen guests all trying to check out. Not one of the FOUR kiosks where you can check in or out on your own were functioning, so everyone was forced to wait in line. When I finally was able to check out, I found out that they did not adjust the computer to reflect both confirmations being in the same room. It wasn't until I was almost done with my check out, did a second person come to help at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: WendyTN
Reviews.Content: As promised by the hotel's website, the view of the state capitol from our room was spectacular. Unfortunately, we couldn't enjoy the view from the bed. The bed was positioned so that we had a view of a brick wall out of our room's windows. But, the bed itself was incredibly comfortable. Despite that, we found it difficult to get to sleep because of the street noise we could hear inside our room. Although we were on the 19th floor, we could hear motorcycles racing on the street below the hotel until midnight. In fairness, there appeared to be a motorcycle convention in town, so the hotel may be quieter at other times. I was also disappointed by the bathroom in this hotel room. The rolled up vinyl bathmat by the tub was disgusting, and I expected, but did not find, a magnifying makeup mirror like most big city hotels provide. Although I appreciated the low voltage florescent lighting above the bathroom vanity, it was too dim for applying makeup. Overall, the room was comfortable, but had a dingy feeling. The carpet seemed worn, and the overstuffed chairs felt "overused" - when we sat in them, we sank so far down that we thought the springs were broken. After the motorcylce noise on the street died down, we had a good night's sleep, but I would not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff corrected numerous concerns.”
Reviews.Author: BBuddy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Indianapolis for a business conference. They are doing construction on the plaza in front of the hotel so after I got off the shuttle it was a bit difficult to figure out how to get into the building. It was next to a mall and a very short distance from lots of restaurants, although the city appeared to close down after 6 PM. I checked in on Monday and stayed through Friday. Check in was easy, I was asked if I wanted a higher or lower floor and preferred higher. The lobby was very well maintained and the elevators were quick. I was on the top floor, #20, in the farthest room from the elevators. I wondered if these rooms were given to people paying less because the window in this room did not look outside but rather the inside of the hotel (it was like overlooking the inside of a mall because there was an office building attached to it and I could look into the offices. The two biggest drawbacks to this room were that you couldn’t tell what the weather was outside and whether to bring an umbrella and that you could hear the lobby music from the hotel. Because I could hear music in my room at 10PM I called down and they lowered it. The room was very comfortable except for the deodorizer which I believed they used daily on the carpet, it was very fragrant and gave me a headache. A nice perk was that they gave you a small tube of toothpaste in the room. There was a small refrigerator in the room too. Because I was the last room on the floor it seemed that everyday I was the last room to be made up. I typically left my room early in the day to attend the conference and everyday when I returned at about 1 my room was still not made. On one occasion I had to call downstairs because they hadn’t made up the room. On the second night of my stay at about 10:30 PM someone was turned on above the room that made the whole ceiling shake and rattle. It turns out that there were air regulators above my room that was used to vent the bathrooms in the building and the whole mechanism was quite noisy. The front desk did have an engineer come up and he told me that the air handlers were above my room and he would shut them off. (This happened again and again I called to have them shut off) The staff was very helpful and addressed any concerns I had quickly. Even to the point of calling me back days later to see if everything was going well. However, they never offered to change my room at any time, however the hotel could have been sold out as there were several conferences going on. The hotel does not have free internet service and spotty wifi service. You either have to connect hard wire to the hotel service and pay 9.99 a day or buy the T-mobile wifi service for the same price. Note that the T-mobile service had a number of dead spots and did not work in the conference rooms and when it did work service was slow. The gym was a typical gym for a hotel. It had several treadmills and ellipticals with some weight machines and dumbbells. Not fancy, but if you do a light workout it would probably be fine. There is the national Institute of Fitness and Sports nearby (about a 12 minute walk) that has all the equipment and weight trainer could need including an indoor trace and lots of aerobic classes. I only ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant but it was fantastic. The breakfast buffet was $14.00 and it included made to order omelets and lots of fresh fruit and breads. The staff was attentive and courteous. I would definitely stay here again if I was in Indianapolis except I would not stay in room #2035 which was quite noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great but get at a discount”
Reviews.Author: arualpalm
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for one night but would have been happy to stay more. Staff is wonderful and helpful. The lobby area is elegant. The rooms are comfortable, clean, and mine contained a mini-refrigerator. I enjoyed exercising in the refreshing and warm-water (although small) pool. The exercise area looked nice as well, but I imagine one would not want to get there during crunch times of the day. Indianapolis downtown offers plenty of places to eat, movies, shopping, and other activities within a few blocks of the hotel. My only gripe, which I failed to share with staff because I was too tired that evening and was in a rush at a.m. check-out, was the heating/cooling in the rooms. No matter what I set the thermostat at, the room temperature did not change; my colleagues stated they experienced the same issue. Luckily, I wrapped a blanket around my head and was able to fend off the too-cool room. I would stay here again but would make sure to resolve the heating issue before I settled into bed.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Stella16bella
Reviews.Content: I prebooked and prepaid my stay at the Hyatt Regency but when the day to stay came we had whiteout blizzard conditions at home and were not able to travel. I tried calling the hotel and explaining the conditions and asked to move the reservation forward a day. I was treated very rudely by the agent and they refused the request. I am a VIP card holder for Hyatt hotels brands I have never had this type of service at any of the other hotels. I didn't want a refund or to cancel the reservation, I was simply asking to move it forward a day because the weather conditions made it dangerous to travel and the region I live in was under an emergency alert. Horrible place.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Pay Full Price”
Reviews.Author: snake2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights January 9th & 10th. Fortunately, I booked the room on Priceline and got it for $55 per night. The going rate on these rooms is between $135-160. The location is perfect, the lobby has been renovated and is very nice, the customer service is impeccable, and I suspect that's why they can charge those rates. My problem is with the room we had - I asked if there was a complimentary upgrade available and they gave us a corner room which they said is a bigger room. I would hate to see a "regular" room. This room was small, decor dated and the lighting was not sufficient. That alone left me wondering how Priceline could rate this hotel 4 stars. We had drinks at Level One cocktail lounge, and it was very nice. Cannot speak for the restaurants as we did not visit them. Valet parking is $28 per day with in and out privileges. I would recommend doing that if you're driving; self parking is just a few dollars more. If I had paid full price for my room, I would have had a problem paying that parking fee, but at $55 per night, it didn't bother me. I love, love, love Priceline. However, I expected a nicer, more well-appointed room for a 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: melkozek
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Hyatt just before New Year's Eve, particularly because of Nick who helped us at the reception desk. The location is great, the room was clean and large, and the beds were very comfortable. All the employees we encountered were helpful and very friendly especially Nick. The hotel is very large and was preparing for the upcoming New Year's Eve celebration. Even though they were busy with preparations we found that the valet parking guys were courteous and helpful and even the maintenance staff went out of their way to be helpful. We wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Hyatt the next time we are in Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor for cost of room”
Reviews.Author: Missie1
Reviews.Content: Not a very good bargain for the price and watch the parking fees if you should happen to stay on the night of a Colts game! Ask for valet parking; otherwise, it will cost you $20.00 until 6:00 a.m. then an additional $3/$4 per hour thereafter! Older rooms, no happy hour, no breakfast of any kind (restaurant VERY expensive). IMO, Embassy Suites is a MUCH better deal (right around the corner).

Reviews.Title: “Dirty-looking room/ bathroom, terrible room service”
Reviews.Author: cmxAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Room/ bathroom was not clean. Loads of dust on the bedroom floor, black marks on the bathroom wall, brown dirt around the washbasin taps. Generally the room/ bathroom did not feel clean. In addition the lighting in the bedroom was poor. Finally, the room service was terrible. On the day I checked out (Dec 9), for breakfast I was given 4 pieces of completely burnt toast... I found it unbelievable how any self respecting staff/ management could deliver food in this condition to a guest's room. When I complained about it, the woman on room service phone duty assured me that she would reduce my invoice however when I got my final bill I discovered that she did not do this. My only positive comment is that the male receptionist at the front desk was very courteous and did reduce my final bill. However, overall this hotel is substandard.

Reviews.Title: “If this tis typical, this chain is in trouble.”
Reviews.Author: epoto
Reviews.Content: The electronic door lock failed twice, the Internet service was shaky, I was not given the refund I was promised for its failure, the restaurants have odd hours, and the conference rooms were average. However, the staff was polite and friendly, and the location is good. If this operation is typical of the chain, the chain is in trouble. I would stay here again if and only if there was an event here I was attending.

Reviews.Title: “Well - the location is great, BUT....”
Reviews.Author: MotherHen
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed at Hyatt (saw Robin Williams at the Merat) Nov 13-15. The location is in the center of the city and is convenient to everything. The staff there were professional and helpful. But last comment is correct. Hotel rooms are VERY outdated. Peeling, old wall paper, old TV and SQUEAKY bed with no solid frame. Makes those "special" moments a little difficult to enjoy. Bathtubs were slippery. They had mats but the housekeeping took the mat away after the first cleanup and did not return it. Housekeeping did not refill our shampoo/conditioner. We were given new towels. BRAND new....they weren't washed EVER and my husband and I were covered in white fuzz (you don't get that if you wash new towels) which was just a pain to get off. Other than that, the Eagle's Nest - rotating restaurant at the top of the hotel - had beautiful views and made for a nice place for a drink before dinner (outside the hotel). Places to eat locally - Patachou for fab breakfast, Palamino's for lunch, St Elmo's for steak dinner and OUTSTANDING wine list.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, run down”
Reviews.Author: hichin22
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? When we walked into the lobby, we thought "wow, nice hotel", but then we got into our room, and realized all the $$$ were lavished on the lobby and restaurants. The room looked like it hadn't been refurbished in 20 years. Seriously. The carpeting was worn, the door to the bathroom was misaligned and would not close, the wiring was scarily hanging from the wall outlets, the TV was an old style rounded tube CRT, and worst of all, there was mold literally growing in the corners up by the ceiling where the ventilation was blowing. Stay far away from this place, there are far better choices in downtown Indy.

Reviews.Title: “They bill you for everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sanshu
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed that you had to pay daily for internet connection. Most hotels now have free wi-fi--so didn't understand that! Second, parking is $20 a day. The hotel doesn't have it's on parking and will not validate parking tickets. First time I have had that happen also. Rooms were nice and beds were comfy....the bathroom is huge!!! Very convenient to convention center, nighttime dining and mall...walkways connected to all!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel right in the heart of things”
Reviews.Author: ceeceerose
Reviews.Content: This very sleek and modern hotel was perfect for us in Indianapolis. It is situated right in the center of things...offers good service...great meeting space. The staff was friendly and went out of their way each and every time. Maybe another restaurant could be added, but the area surrounding has tons of close options. Parking is a pain...the lot is a confusing mess, so if you can, valet!

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced with few services”
Reviews.Author: Robbie69
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel. Its location is close to Lucas Oil Stadium and it has a nice atrium in the hotel lobby. But the room was really small. We asked for two queen-sized beds but they only had two full-sized beds. An office chair was dangerous. Two of us almost fell over backwards. The bathroom was huge, almost a 1/3 the size of the room, with a walk-in shower. But water from the shower went out into the bathroom making the entire bathroom a skating rink. There is a charge for everything. $3 for a bottle of water; 99 cents for local calls; no newspaper in the morning; no free internet or breakfast; $5.95 for 15 minutes on the internet and that didn't even work. I had to fight to get a credit. The hotel said the computers were handled by another company. With my problems on the internet, they said they would waive my telephone charges at check-out, but it still appeared on my credit card. Even with the close proximity, we would have stayed elsewhere. If I had a choice, I would have stayed at the Embassy Suites across the street. We stayed there the third night. Embassy Suites provided two rooms in a suite; free newspaper; free breakfast; free Happy Hour in the evening; and were not as snobby as the Hyatt Regency.

Reviews.Title: “Good not Great”
Reviews.Author: VAJill
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Indianapolis is a nice hotel with a great location. The rooms were okay, a little run down and not immaculate. There were a lot of hidden fees. I had a "Business Plan" but I wasn't clear about what I would be charged for. My room was not cleaned one day. The restaurant where the breakfast was served was top notch. The food was fresh and delicious and the staff went out of their way to help. I would not go out of my way to stay at this hotel again. I think the Hilton chain does a much better job overall.

Reviews.Title: “Very Solid Property”
Reviews.Author: Iflyyx
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night and had a very favorable impression overall. Rooms were clean and furniture/fixtures in good repair. Had a standard king room and it was larger than I would have expected for a downtown property. The open atrium concept can allow a fair bit of noise to seep into the room at some Hyatt's. This property, however, was very quiet -- not a sound from adjoining rooms and the windows provided excellent soundproofing from downtown noises. Hotel is connected to a sizeable skywalk system that connects to the downtown mall (which, unlike many downtown malls, is quite vibrant), the convention center, other hotels, restaurants, etc. One block from the capitol building. Excellent location with plenty of dining options within 1 - 2 blocks. Breakfast/lunch restaurant provided good quality food (with the typical hotel markup). Very nice exercise facility (including chilled towels), cardio equipment comes with headphones for use with the personal TVs on each piece of equipment, small pool. My rate included valet parking (which allows in/out privileges), but normally will set you back $28/day. There is self parking for $20 (but no in/out). Would return here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel -- Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TexiCan_Edge
Reviews.Content: This highrise hotel is located in downtown Indianapolis. This location is 15 minute walk from most of the downtown attractions (Lucas Oil Stadium, baseball stadium, canal district, and the central circle). It is a $40 cab ride from the airport. The rooms were clean and nice. The bed was comfortable. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't speak to the hotel food experience. The hotel is also connected into a series of covered walkways linking to parking, other hotels, downtown mall. It has a larger sized spa, but the pool is barely big enough to swim laps.

Reviews.Title: “Currently my 3rd choice for downtown Indy”
Reviews.Author: cagood
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fine place to stay, but would be my 3rd choice (after the Conrad and Westin). The room really seemed on the small side at first, but was fine for one or two people. The room had all the standard fare -- decent decor. Although the sheets didn't seem to quite fit the bed. It only took one turn to untuck them and expose the mattress. The bathroom seemed oddly large in relationship to the room. Also, the bathroom seemed a bit dated -- like some remodeling has occured, but not everything. The exercise room was nice and had enough equipment to provide a decent workout. The pool and hot tub were small and not very inviting -- stainless steel shell seemed too theraputic. The hotel location is good -- connected to many buildings/attractions by skywalks. No free wi-fi ... drives me nuts that every cheapo hotel/motel sign you see on the highway offers and/or boasts about free internet, but upscale downtown hotels charge extra.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading Customer Service - Will Nickel and Dime You”
Reviews.Author: rutan13
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to Indianapolis every summer for the last 7 years and this was by far the worst hotel we've stayed at. I don't know if it was intentional or not but I feel like we were terribly misled regarding some of the fees and amenities. I tend to give the benefit of the doubt one and think "maybe I didn't hear them right" but when it happens to you three times, I think something shady is going on. For starters, they advertise self-parking for $20 and valet for $28 on their website. However, when you get there they tell you the $20 is only if you leave your car for 12 hours or more. Less than that and you have to pay an hourly rate. I was incredibly disappointed in this because I even called ahead to confirm the parking prices prior to our trip and there was no mention of in-and-out fees, just the $20 daily self park. When I spoke to the manager about this she claimed that this was b/c they use a City garage and have no control over thhe be rate and all the hotels in the area are on the same arrangement.
