That is not true. The previous year we stayed at the embassy suites across the street and paid $20 to self park and were able to go in-and-out as we pleased. That was strike 1. Next, the hotel advertises wi-fi as one if its "amenities" but when you get there they charge you $9.95 a day. There is no mention of this fee on their website so I naturally assumed wi-fi would be fee as I stay in hotels probably 15x a year for work/leisure and have not been charged for internet access in at least 3 years. I complained to the manager that I don't consider paying for something everyone else offers for free to be an "amenity" and she did waive the fee after some spirted discussion. Strike 2. Finally, we had a package which included breakfast. Again, I double checked this on the phone when I made the reservation and when we checked into the hotel. So both days we stayed we ate at their breakfast buffet as that is what we were told to do. When we checked in, the front desk said the restaurant would bring us a bill and to charge it to the room and they would delete the charge at checkout. However, when we left they told us our package only included 1 breakfast per day and we would have to pay for the other one. At a cost of $20 each! For a simple buffet that you would get free at any hampton inn or homewood! Strike 3.... In summary, I felt their customer service was very poor for being a Hyatt and many of the fees and charges were misleading at best. I would urge anyone considering this hotel to consider the total cost of the stay and not just the room rate they advertise as they wil hit you up for a number of things most hotels provide for free. There are much greater values in the Indianapolis Area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: mwm308
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and in a great location. The convention center is located through a second floor pass through. St Elmos restaurant and the rest of the fine steak houses are located within one block walk. The evening social scene is great with many bars to choose from. The room ( I stayed on the 19th floor) was very comfortable and quick to get to from the ground floor. There are 4 elevators running at all times. The Beds were nice and the linen was clean. The rooms are quiet even thought they face into the atrium. Be aware that the under building parking is very very low. If you drive a large Hummer or very large SUV you may not be able to park below the building. Also be aware that parking is $20.00 per day or $28.00 per day for in and out valet parking. There are a few places to eat within the hotel from a simple Subway to your run of the mill sit down restaurant to the Eagles Nest revolving restaurant on the top floor. I was there for business so I didnt check out the pool or workout room. The staff was attentive and friendly as you would expect from the Hyatt. As a side note, the third floor conference rooms and ball rooms were easy and quick to get to from all of the rooms. The food service and bar service that we ordered for the meetings were all excellent. I would absolutely stay here again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: polarspeech
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel located downtown. All the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel was beautiful- the waterfall with the glass elevators was wonderful. The hotel has 24 hour gym (a big plus), Starbucks on site, comfortable beds and great food and bar. It is accesible to a mall. The downside is that internet costs you as well as any computer access in their business center. If you plan on having breakfast, use the internet daily and need some water for your workout- pay a little extra for the business plan- you can save 5-10/day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect as usual with HYATT!!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelhowaboutu
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful as usal with any Hyatt brand hotel. The staff was overly attentive. The breakfast buffet in One South was wonderful for $14.95 that includes drink. Valet parking was $28 a day with in/out privelages, or you can self park for $20/24hours- this is cheaper unless you want to leave, the first hour is $5, and the clock restarts everytime you come and go. For internet they have t-mobile hot spot, it is $9.99 a day for a pass. The hotel has acess to the Circle Center mall and wonderful dining.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: LDO514
Reviews.Content: this hotel was completely awesome, I have no complaints what so ever. right in the middle fo Indy, walking distance from lots of restaurants and the convention center. Price was completely amazing...expected it to be a lot more. Front desk staff was soooo nice. I stayed in the executive suite and it was absolutely awesome and amazing. How many times can I say awesome! inside the hotel is simply beautiful. food places in lobby area. this made it convenient to grab a bite at the hotel before going out. If given the opportunity, I would definitely stay here again. I have reservations to stay at another hyatt in Dallas in June, I hope it's just as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Professional and Honest Staff”
Reviews.Author: RockinRod65
Reviews.Content: spent a weekend in Indianapolis the staff was very friendly and helpful, hotel was clean and well lit. The rooms were clean and very well decorated When we arrived home the wife noticed she had left her purse in the room "Panic " and I had left a shirt. We made a call to the hotel and within a few days the purse with all belongings and shirt showed up at our home. That is the kind of hotel you look for. Thank-you

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, sophisticated, efficient”
Reviews.Author: ddjd1358
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is a sleek, modern hotel located in the heart of everyting in Indianapolis and connected by walkways to the mall,convention center and other hotels to keep you out of the weather. Gracious but efficient service including a well trained and informed staff make staying here a pleasure. Although it is an open atrium style hotel, we marveled at how quiet it was during a two night stay. A good choice for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel! Great value on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: coach02
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on valentines weekend at a great price from bidding on Priceline! i was able to park the car and walk everywhere i wanted to go. The rooms were very nice and spacious. The beds were very comfortable. There lobby was very nice with an open atrium. There was a convention this weekend so it was sort of crowded. I would definately stay here again; especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, filthy rooms!”
Reviews.Author: schendo01
Reviews.Content: This was a return visit to Hyatt, but that won't happen again. Valet was rude and pretty much insisted we selfpark. When we checked in we were directed to the wrong room only to find the room assigned to us (a family of four) had only a murphy bed and a sleeper sofa that you had to climb over to even enter the room. Upon returning to the front desk, we were assigned another room that was more accomodating to our family. An hour later our luggage finally arrived to our room. The bathtub had a grey sludge in the bottom which I scrubbed myself but made the children shower in their socks just to be safe. The vent below the sink in the bathroom had "chunks" of dust and dirt hanging from it, as if it hadn't been cleaned in months. My daughter has severe allergies that were aggrevated everytime she entered the bathroom. When we ordered room service we were told it would be 20 to 30 minute wait. After an hour and a half our food finally arrived. I am also surprised that a hotel of this size has such a small pool. We originally chose the Hyatt because of the convenience of location and quality of service usually found at a Hyatt. We will be staying at the Westin on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Veery Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FISHERMANDOC
Reviews.Content: THIS HOTEL IS BY FAR THE WORSE I HAVE STAYED AT IN MANY YEARS. Problems started from check in throughout stay. Our first room was a corner room that was dirty and had only a roll away bed. We were moved to a conventional room with two double beds. We had requested a king. The internet connection was expensive and unreliable. The primary problem at this hotel is the staff. Everyone was extremely unfriendly and rude. They gave you a feeling that you were doing something wrong. I usually stay at the Hilton or a Marriott but thought I would try Hyatt. Don't think I wil try them again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jafpitt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for one nite at the Hyatt as we got a hit on a bid via priceline. What a terrific stay. If we could have, we would have stayed a few more nites. The hotel is beautiful and very well managed. Rooms are very clean and modern. The hotel is in the center of downtown and a short walk to the canal park as well as many numerous restaurants. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful (allowed me a late checkout with no problem). We parked across the street for $12/day, which was much better than the hotel valet at $25 and other nearby garages at $20. By the way, there was no construction anywhere that I could see in the lobby of the hotel. The Nordstrom mall is across the street, which has numerous stores. Only negative, there is a charge for internet service..which I excluded due to the price...hate that part of it, but most hotels are doing that now.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hyatt - Expensive & Conveninet Location”
Reviews.Author: Katsandcards_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed this past weekend at the Hyatt downtown during the MotoGP event. It's a beautiful downtown Hyatt - very utlra-modern decorations and furnishings - huge building. The hotel atrium is also the atrium for an office building - so a hotel bar, Subway, McDonalds & 3 restaurants are in the "lobby". Hotel staff was extremely attentive and friendly. Hotel pakring is CRAZY expensive. The hotel does not have self parking - but does have a city run garage located right under the hotel. All city garages are $20 a day. And during special events (there was a Kenny Chesney concert on Sat night) the garage charges an extra $20 for event parking. We arrived Thurs night and left Mon morning - pakring cost us over $90. The hotel is conveniently located downtown within easy walking distance to all restaurants and across the street from the Simon Mall. The hotel was clean, the room was spacious (for a standard room) - but we felt the room was a little pricey at $249 a night. This would be a great business meeting hotel - but for our next vacation we may look around to see if we can get a better deal downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Very convienent”
Reviews.Author: rmke
Reviews.Content: First time I used priceline and am sold! The hotel was great, easy access anything downtown! Staff was great! Nice bar, but wish we would of gone up for a drink at least in the rotating restaurant! Next time if we have more time! We got the room really cheap but it was a Thurs night!

Reviews.Title: “Strictly an Expense Account Place”
Reviews.Author: HonestReviewForU
Reviews.Content: Normally when I travel, the firm lets me rent a car and stay where I want. That generally means a Candlewood Suites or a TownePlace Suites. But for a big meeting they booked rooms at the Hyatt. Too bad, because my usual way of going about things would've been better all around. For $165 (+ tax) a night you get a room and not much else. As noted by others, Internet is $10/day. I took the wired option and luckily carry my own cable, as their cable was broken. And when they say $10 for 24-hours, they mean it; the connection shut off exactly 24-hours after I paid, so I had to stop working to once again click on the payment agreement. The room was clean enough, but the entire place could use a makeover, as it's showing its age. The air conditioning alternated between meat locker and sauna, all the while rattling like a subway train. TV had lots of sports stations but few others. No Comedy Central; I'm suffering Colbert withdrawal. Skip the $3 bottles of Aquafina they leave and bring your own water to put in the in-room fridge (which I'm surprised didn't have a coin box). Weird clockradio allows you to dock your iPod but has no instructions for correcting the time of day. The business center that on their Web site appears to be an amenity is little more than a stickup of $6 for 15-minutes of Internet access. Fortunately, there's a computer in the lobby for printing boarding passes free of charge (don't get any ideas; it's rigged to go only to those airline Web pages). I'd also recommend the 4 self-serve check-in/out kiosks, which were easy to use. The limited front desk staff seemed highly unconcerned.

Reviews.Title: “Room nice, everything else sucked”
Reviews.Author: topkatluvr
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are great. Comfy beds, good shower, nice amenities. There were two bottles of water on the dresser when I arrived, along with the $2.00 apiece price tag. No thank you. The hotel's website advertised a Starbucks in the lobby. Nope, nothing but a mess of construction with dust and plywood walkways everywhere. The elevators are very s-l-o-o-o-o-o-o-w. Parking fees are exorbitant ($20-$25). Wi-fi is not free ($10 per day) even though it shows it as a room amenity, nor is use of the business center ($5.95 for 15 minutes of internet access). The capper for the stay was that there was NO HOT WATER for two days. Gee, thanks, I enjoy being out in public smelling bad and looking like a total mess. So much for a 5-star hotel. The lack of hot water was due to a City project being done over Labor Day weekend. It didn't get finished on time. Did the hotel offer any options? Oh, heck no. Did they offer any sort of freebie to make up for the major inconvenience? Oh, heck no. I hope they enjoyed throwing out the filthy sheets (quite a number of us had been at the drag races and were really dirty) and draining and scrubbing the pool and hot tub. The lounge on the second floor is open to the atrium and the noise from it carries all through the hotel common areas. This is not necessarily something a lot of people want to listen to. A bunch of drinkers laughing uproariously and carrying on, using foul language, etc. No thanks. Bad design.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations with issues of concern”
Reviews.Author: Nighthawk416
Reviews.Content: I was in the Hyatt Regency for five days while in Indianapolis for a business meeting, taking the first two days for some sightseeing opportunities in a city with which I'm not familiar. My stay at the Hyatt was overall a nice stay but there were some issues that I encountered that made the stay less that it might otherwise have been. The room was wonderful, the furniture was excellent, the bed and pillows were as comfortable as one could want, the air conditioning was effective, the water pressure was good, and the maid service was perfect. If the room itself were all that were being graded, this would be a top-notch review, excellent all the way. I heard comments by some attending a convention while I was there that the hotel had not been in the best of shape in the past. That has changed. I could not ask more comfort from the room. Price: if you drive, add $20/day for self parking or $25/day for valet parking to your room price. If you use the internet, add $10/day for internet access. So whatever your quoted room price is, add at least $30 per day. Soft drink machines charge $2 for a 20oz drink and do not accept cash, only credit cards. Check in and check our were quick and easy. My special request for my room was not honored, possibly due to the convention taking place. As usual, the luggage carts are reserved for bell service, so, unlike with less expensive hotels, I had to make several trips between my room and car to move my belongings. PROBLEM 1 - There are insufficient elevators though they did not seem to be excessively slow. There was a small convention at the hotel (about 500 people they told me) over the weekend and the first couple of days of the week and the elevators were often jammed. Sometimes it was hard to get the elevators to move when the doors closed.Not only did I notice this, the convention attendees were regularly complaining about how long it took to get an elevator. The hotel staff used the passenger elevators for bell service and there were several wheelchair-bound convention attendees who were having trouble getting a place on the elevators. If the elevator service is inadequate with a small convention there, I cannot imagine how it would be with a larger one. PROBLEM 2 - There is an adjacent mall with food court but the hours of the businesses was uneven. Nothing seemed to be open for breakfast on the weekend. After a couple of trips over there, which requires quite a walk, I quit going. There were plenty of nice restaurants in the block across the street from the hotel, so there were no problems at lunch or in the evenings. In the hotel lobby are a MacDonalds and Subway, neither of which seemed to have adequate staff to handle the demand of the small convention, even on the weekday mornings. The service at the MacDonald's rivaled any place that I have been for the worst I've seen. There is a very high priced restaurant in the hotel where breakfast can be obtained - but it is costly. All in all, the stay was OK but the hotel needs a coffee bar and something needs to be done about the elevators. They were a significant enough problem to affect any decision to stay at this location in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Another Bowden Review: Got this for $45 on priceline”
Reviews.Author: Bowden68
Reviews.Content: You read correctly, two nights for $45 a night. It's right downtown near the convention center across the street from the RCA dome. Lots of places to walk to, get dinner and drink a few beers. A very safe part of the city with lots to do. Clean area, lots of police patroling. The hotel is large, and a big city hotel. The lobby is awesome, with a great bar and multiple places to eat. There is a mall connected to the hotel so you can shop and not go outside if the weather is bad. The Convention center is also connected. The rooms are nice, albiet a little small. Comfortable beds and modern furniture. The only draw back is you have to pay $18 to self park or $25 to valet. But it is worth it being downtown. At $45 this was a steal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but...”
Reviews.Author: IndianaRealtor
Reviews.Content: NIce hotel. We are on the 18th floor as I write this. Getting off of the elevator walking to our rooms there is a distinct mildew smell by the ice/vending machines. Also $9.99/day or can buy minutes etc... for internet access! C'mon! Room is clean and well furnished for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “prepare to be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: stb71
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at the Hyatt through Priceline. We recently stayed at the Hyatt in Lexington, KY - which is only given *three* stars, but is a much superior hotel. We are not the type that are easily annoyed -- I know there are plenty of those on Tripadvisor. But even so, our brief visit was tainted by a few annoyances too much to overlook. First, the good - * The beds are very comfortable * The lobby and atrium is very impressive * The front desk and bellhops are very friendly and helpful * Right in the middle of everything in downtown Now, the bad - * The pool/hot tub is tiny, and closes at 10pm. Worse, the next morning it was also closed with no explanation given. At noon, it was still closed. We could only speculate that they had water quality problems, as the pool was very cloudy. * Rooms feel cramped. * We noticed black mold in the shower. * As others mentioned, Wi-Fi is nowhere to be found except high-priced T-mobile pay service. * The parking garage has a 6'-2" limit. If you have a luggage carrier, you are classified as an oversized vehicle and must pay the $27 valet fee. Overall, it is a pretty nice property that would sit firmly in the 3-star category. Just because a hotel has a great lobby/atrium and location does not make it 4-star if it has all of the shortcomings we found. Unless you are here for a conference or something else, I would recommend trying another location.

Reviews.Title: “The only thing nice about this place are the building, security and location.”
Reviews.Author: mpaulet
Reviews.Content: I was in Indy for dinner and a show with the kids. I priceline a room my offer was acceepted at the Hyatt Regency in downtown Indy for June 14, 2008. I was very pleased as I had recently stayed at a Hyatt Select south of Nashville which was fantastic. So, I get to the hotel and find out that in order to park I have to either self park for $18 or pay a valet for $25 for the night. I get to the room to look something up and the internet is $10.00 per day. I made a toll free telephone call and that was $1.00. Do you see a pattern? I hate supposedly "better" hotels that nickle and dime you to death. The building is very nice looking. Check out and check in are automated. I suppose to save on staffing and customer service. The rooms are small and almost spartan. Most hotels in the two star or better category have nicer rooms. Next, I go to shower and the water that comes out in brown and cold. I call and they tell me that they are having an issue with the water. While I shave with this filthy water, my daughter trips and hits her face on a piece of furniture. I call to the front desk and ask for help and they say that they will send security and an EMT right away. 25 minutes later, I call down and tell them to cancel the EMT and that I would take my daughter to the hospital myself. They apologized and said that the person who took the call did not take note of what room I was calling from. Maria from security then came up while I got ready to leave and she was as nice as she could be. She helped me find directions to the hospital and even had complimentary ice cream brought up for my kids by way of apology when we got back. Maria was also the only person that I had personal contact with during my entire stay. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice decor”
Reviews.Author: missingmpls
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great--within walking distance to the canal district and many great restaurants. The rooms seemed very modern and well decorated while also very comfortable. The front desk staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “very good convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: GSC4ever
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice convention hotel with walkway access to the convention center. The rooms are very modern, though a bit small, with incredibly comfortable beds and tiled bathroom. There are many restaurants nearby. The hotel bar and One South restaurant were good. I was not able to try the revolving rooftop restaurant, unfortunately. The hotel gym is well equipped with treadmills, ellipitcals, cycles, free weights, LifeFitness resistance machines, medicine balls, exercise balls, and tubing. It is open 24 hours a day with guest key access. The lap pool is open until 10 pm, 4' deep. There is a hot tub. One downside is that Internet access is pay only for either cable or wireless, not even free wireless in the lobby. There is a refrigerator but no microwave. I had no complaints with the elevators. I felt they worked fine and I always had a short wait.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, good downtown location”
Reviews.Author: kcrampton
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt for 2 nights for a business trip. Got a good corporate rate, but you have to pay for parking (garage underneath the hotel) and internet access (I didn't use it). Some reviews complained about the elevators, but I had no delays - they do have a glass back wall to see the hotel interior. The hotel was recently renovated, and everything was nice & clean. The bed was good, with plenty of extra pillows. The bathroom was large with lots of counter space. The workout room was good, although the pool is NOT 24-hours. I just missed it at 10 p.m. closing time. The downstairs bar, store, restaurants, etc. were convenient. The location was good for my purposes - not far from the circle. I can't think of anything special about the place, but also nothing to really complain about.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, slooooooowwwww elevators”
Reviews.Author: kell7
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in our room the smell was horrible. We called the front desk and the staff was very friendly and helpful. They apologized and gave us a new room immediately. Our next room was wonderful. Very large and comfortable. The pool area is rather small but my daughter still had a good time. The only complaint we had were the elevators. We waited for 15 minutes at times. The shortest wait was 5 minutes. It was really bad. We were on the 14th floor so for me stairs were not an option. We are staying there again this weekend and will request a low floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice....but...........”
Reviews.Author: vwatkins
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at the Hyatt just this past Saturday (3/1) for a company party. Here is my one and only complaint.....from 6 to 7 p.m. was cocktail hour. It was all set up in the lobby area. Very nice, exept they started taking all the food away at about 6:40 p.m. By the time we waited in a huge line for our drinks...the food was gone. I know this may sound like a stupid complaint, but I thought it was rude of them to start tearing down before the time they were suppose to. I feel the people who paid for this party should know about this. Our room was clean and the view was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “nice & comfortable, but don't like "extra" charges”
Reviews.Author: Larryo
Reviews.Content: $10 extra for high speed internet, around $23 for parking. A hotel of this class should not charge for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous Elevators”
Reviews.Author: honeypie1
Reviews.Content: Wait for an elevator ranged anywhere from 2 minutes to as much as 15 minutes. No exaggeration, I assure you. The staff must tire from hearing all the complaints about them as there is nothing they can do. I realize it's busy but it is always busy except the few hours before check in and after check out.. With this in mind, I will never stay at this Hyatt again. All the nice things everyone before me said are true: Location, restaurants, mall etc. This one thing is something that can't be changed and won't be so I will stay somewhere else next time. My advice if you choose this hotel: when the door opens, get in, even if it isn't going the direction you are.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellet Location”
Reviews.Author: niqr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean, great helpful staff, the bed were very confortable. The TV was a little old and didn't work properly, the bathroom was spacious,the view of the front plaza with the snow was super. The onsite restaurant with the breakfast buffet is a SUPER PLUS, they also have a pizzeria, mcdonalds and subway on property. The Concierge was very helpful with directions and reservations including the bus schedules and directions to places out of town. The conference rooms are very clean and usefull. The indoor pool is great. The best thing about this hotel is the skywalk, you can get to a lot of places downtown Indianapolis including the Circle Centre Mall without going outside of the hotel. Believe me when there're 6" of snow and temp of 15 degrees this is a super plus.

Reviews.Title: “woman on business trip”
Reviews.Author: redwing67
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for conference. Used valet parking ($25). Well worth the price since I arrived on a Sunday as the Colts were playing in the dome and there is NO self parking to be had. Check in was fast. i arrived before the posted check in time but my room was ready for occupancy. Bed was confortable. View,from the 6th floor was great. I was able to people watch as they left the game. It is nice to be able to dash over to the Circle Centre Mall without having to go outside. Several nice restaurants to grab a bite in the mall. Most notable is a cafe tucked away in Nordstroms. Felt very safe during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Loyal Hyatt Client says stay away”
Reviews.Author: Teddie38
Reviews.Content: I stay at Hyatts at least 10x a year I will find somewhere else to stay when in Indianapolis The Hyatt Regency Indianapolis was terrible. Staff was rude The toliet was soiled with feces. They charge you $5.00 a package for anything sent to hotel. The alarm went off and i walked down stairs and front desk didnt even know alarm was going off

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: issy221
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a mess from the start. When booking, they did not inform our travel agent that there would be construction. We checked in and there was a sign stating there would be construction starting at 8 am each morning which wasn't a big deal because we were there working and would be up around then anyway. Well, on both mornings the construction started much earlier at like 6:30 am or 7 am. My co-worker called the front desk to complain and they told him that they would stop them (which they didn't.) The last night of our stay, I was woken up at 2 am to someone vacuuming outside of my room. Overall, the stay was not very good and the hotel was a mess. It is very convenient to the convention center, but it was not worth it. After my stay I did write a letter to Hyatt just to share my experiences and I didn't even get the courtesy of a reply.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Middle of Everything”
Reviews.Author: purplevegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency at the Capitol on 9/30/07 to be close to a Colts game that we were attending. The hotel was very easily accessible even though it's in the heart of downtown Indianapolis and was within walking distance of the RCA Dome, Circle Center Mall, Union Station, and the new stadium that is being built. Plenty to see, eat, and do in the immediate area! Getting back to the interstate when we checked out proved no problem, either. Upon check-in, we were told that the only room available at the moment had two double beds and we could try back after 3PM and they should have a king available. However, as we were waiting for the bellman to get our bags, a king room became available and we were checked into our 16th floor room and on our way to have lunch before noon. I believe the hote's website shows the usual check-in time as 3PM. The room had an incredible view of the capitol building, as well as a partial view of IRT. Everything was clean and comfortable and the bathroom was nicely sized. Great water pressure in the shower! High speed internet is available in the room for $9.95 for 24 hours. After the football game, we stopped into the hotel lounge for a drink and had no problem getting service even though the game had just let out. Drink prices were about what you would expect in a hotel bar. Overall, this is a great hotel. However, I'm not sure that I would pay the full price for the room, as the standard room price is significantly more than what I normally pay for a room. I can say, though, that I would definitely stay here again if I can get another great deal from Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “The good bad and ugly”
Reviews.Author: Johnthan
Reviews.Content: The new bar was great , but the britsh guy at the front desk needed some mental help. They did not have a king bed and I had to get a double. When I asked him about it , it was like he was doing me a favor just by letting me into a room a paid for. Stay at the hotel avoid and Britsh guy.

Reviews.Title: “Good business trip”
Reviews.Author: ArlingtonW
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property in August 2007 and found it to be suitable to the average business traveler. The Good: --The staff was incredibly accomodating overall. Each person, from the folks behind the check-in desk, the employees at the Eagle's Nest to the bellmen and valets were very courteous and very nice. I saw one employee get absolutely berated for a several minutes and he took it in stride, handling it the best way he knew how (the dispute was over a business owner who was there for a conference and how the bill had been presented to him). --Room service was actually, for once, above my expectations. It arrived quickly (within 25 minutes) and the food was both hot and tasted good. --Valet service: The way that cars come to the hotel for dropoffs/pickups is a bit tight; the lanes actually run under the second floor of the hotel. The valets did a great job of getting people in and out of their cars and clearing a lane for the next set of vehicles to come through. This was especially impressive in the hour or two before the Indianapolis Colts played the Chicago Bears in a preseason game as many people were parking at the hotel parking deck and the RCA Dome (the Colts' stadium) is literally a block away. --Fitness center. This hotel actually has a fitness center that has a rack of dumbbell weights. Granted, they only go up to fifty pounds, but still--it's the first I've seen. They also have several weight machines where you can work out your chest, back, biceps, shoulders, and legs. The other half of the room contains several treadmills, elliptical machines & stationary bikes. I was fairly impressed. The pool is tiny, and it's an indoor pool, but I've never been keen on hotel pools so it didn't matter much to me. --The bed. I found it to be very comfortable, and while I'm not a big "pillow" person, I kind of liked having 8 or 9 pillows on the bed. The room had its own controls for heating/cooling (some earlier reviews seemed to indicate that this was not the case) and while, yes, the vent is over the bed, it IS adjustable by just standing on the bed and fiddling with the vent slats. An earlier reviewer had mentioned that it was impossible to change the vent and that is not the case. Also, the room had a mini-fridge. --"Stuff" in the lobby. The hotel shares a large open atrium with an office building. On the ground floor of the office-building side, there is a quickie-Italian place (kind of like a a local Sbarro-type place), some sort of breakfast/lunch "tavern" type place, a Subway, a McDonald's and a gift shop. Coupled with the new bar/restaurant that seemingly just opened on the hotel side, you have several places from which to choose to eat breakfast, lunch or dinner without ever having to leave the hotel. --Location, location, location. This hotel, as mentioned before, is a block away from the RCA Dome. It is also connected to the Circle Centre mall (which has dozens of stores and a movie theater). (I would explain how to get to the mall via the Skywalk system, but you're just better off asking a hotel employee so that they can point it out to you.) Several dozen restaurants and/or bars are located within a two to three block area. The state capitol building is also a mere block from the hotel. The Bad: --Yes, the hotel is undergoing renovations. This fact is plastered all over their website. Anyone who has booked this hotel should have known that it was under construction, so is it really fair to complain about the construction? I found that the employees were doing their best with the situation. My only concern was that it seemed as if the construction work was moving...at...a...very...slow...pace. Their website indicated back in March that the renovations would be finished by the beginning of August, but they looked only half-over when I arrived. I had no problems with hearing any construction noise in my room. --Internet access. How can a hotel bill itself as a business traveler's hotel and then charge $12 a day for Internet access? It's absurd. Charge another $12 for the rooms just to at least act like you're trying to be accomodating, Hyatt. --Conference rooms. If you're going to host a conference that expects to have 250 people attending, how about providing ample seating space? For example, setting up a two-person table and cramming three chairs behind it is just a tad bit ridiculous, isn't it? The empty space in the room we were in (on the second floor) could have housed a few more rows of tables, thus freeing up more elbow room for everyone. Also, the chairs became quite uncomfortable after sitting in them for eight hours a day. --If you use their express check-in kiosk, it will ask for you to swipe your credit card so it can identify you. One problem with this is that if your employer booked the room and placed instructions that the charges should be billed to your employer's credit card, checking in at the kiosk will automatically put your personal card as the card that will be charged. It was a hassle getting it switched back, but the hotel employee I dealt with was very professional about it. If you arrive to check in, and your employer is paying for the room, just decline their offer to use the kiosk and wait in line to check in at the desk. --Eagle's Nest restaurant. Possibly one of the worst breakfasts I have ever had. Definitely the worst breakfast buffet that I have ever tasted. The eggs were bland, the "roasted fingerling potatoes" were just plain awful, and the bacon & link sausage each had an odd taste to them. And all for only $15, too! You're essentially paying for the view, which IS amazing--you're at the top of the hotel, and the restaurant is round, and it slowly rotates, so you end up getting a full 360 degree view of the city. The service was pretty good, and the view was great, but nothing could overcome how awful the food was. It was a complete waste of money. You're better off eating at the McDonald's in the lobby--it would be less money AND the food would be better. Things Not Affiliated With the Hotel: --Carey Indiana limousine service is THE way to get where you need to go from the Indianapolis airport. You can reserve a car online (or via phone) and when you arrive at the airport, all you have to do is go to the Ground Transportation Center, check in at the Carey booth, and they'll take care of the rest. It was $12 each way, and the first time I was in a limo and the second in a private town car. The drivers were very professional and took their jobs seriously. --Do not, I repeat, do NOT eat at Mikado Japanese Restaurant (located downtown, two blocks from the hotel). It was, by far, the worst Japanese food I've ever had. --The Colts Team Store in the mall sells a three foot high Peyton Manning bobblehead for $200. That doesn't really pertain to the Hyatt, but I just had to throw that in for shock value. All in all, I had a good trip and the hotel was more than adequate for a weeklong stay. The hotel would be a fine place to stay for a conference at the Indiana Convention Center (less than a block away) or a game at the RCA Dome.

Reviews.Title: “NOT FOR FAMILIES”
Reviews.Author: knjhardy
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to be a big party place. The bar/lounge on the first floor is open to the lobby (no walls or even partial walls to separate.) There was a wedding reception the night my family was there. My 8 year old son was witness to some pretty ignorant behavior displayed by ADULTS who had drank more than necessary. One elevator ride was especially frightening. I actually pushed another floor so I could exit the elevator because I was afraid for my son to hear anymore 4 letter slurred words out of a group of 5 drunks that chose to cram their way onto the elevator with my family and another couple. The pool area is very small for a hotel this size. Our room had an odor to it the entire time. Even the morning of our departure, you could still smell rotten smell. Lobby is under construction so much to look at. While we waiting for our horse drawn carriage just outside the valet area, we saw a rat scurry by. Now, granted, we were outside, but we were still on the Hyatt property. Breakfast in the "Eagle's Nest" was fine. We had the typical hotel buffet. Soggy eggs, potatoes, cereal, pastries, burnt bacon, greasy sausage. Omelets and waffles are made to order which was nice. All in all, I am disappointed with our stay. Friends stayed one block away at the Hilton and had a HUGE room and not as many drunks. We will stay there next,

Reviews.Title: “Eh, typical Hyatt.”
Reviews.Author: Simibot
Reviews.Content: It's bad when you got a great rate on Priceline and STILL would have stayed somewhere else. The renovations at the Hyatt make the lobby look awful, and the rooms are dreary and depressing. I guess most Hyatts are on the same level, but I was not impressed. Met a fellow business traveler at dinner, who said he was staying at the Homewood Suites and absolutely loved it. I will stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a business travel could want”
Reviews.Author: gabelzer
Reviews.Content: I booked the Indianapolis Hyatt for a one-night business trip through Priceline.com, and found this to be a first-class hotel. I highly recommend it. Let me get the negatives out of the way first: 1. Parking- There is apparently no such thing as free, overnight parking in downtown Indianapolis. I had to pay $14 to park overnight at the hotel -- a fee I could have avoided if I stayed in the suburbs. 2. Internet access- There is no free internet access in the room or in the business center. It's my opinion that this is something that is required for a hotel to be absolutely perfect for a business traveler. 3. Construction- The hotel is part of a bigger office building and adjacent to the convention center. There is construction going on, but this caused me no problems. OK, with that out of the way, downtown Indianapolis is thriving, and the Hyatt is across the street or within minutes from a large mall (With Nordstrom's and Carson, Prairie, Scott as anchor stores), a bunch of very good restaurants, retail shopping (including a Border's and a TJ Maxx) and plenty of attractions. So, you can park the car and be assured that you are not "stuck" at the Hyatt- there's plenty to do. The facilities are very nice. The exercise room is well-appointed and includes treadmills with TVs located on the display of each treadmill, so you can select whatever TV program you want to watch while you run, walk, whatever. The pool is very nice as well. Best of all, the rooms are excellent. The beds are comfortable with great pillows and comforters; the closet, bathroom and desk areas are also very good. The bottom line is that this is a great place, and if you need to go to Indianapolis, you likely cannot do better.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Hyatt Regency”
Reviews.Author: cincodes
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Indianapolis on May 12 & 13th for Mother's Day weekend with my 2 children. Upon arrival I was upgraded to a Capitol View Room for the original $99.00 per night. The room had beautiful views of The State Capitol directly accross the street as well as the hustle and bustle of the streets below. It was in a wonderful location being attached to The City Center Mall. There were a few restaurants to choose from located inside the Hotel however even more right outside their doors. We walked down about 3 blocks from the hotel and ate at Hard Rock Cafe. The indoor pool and hottub were a big hit with my kids too. The hotel staff will go out of their way to make sure you are completely satisfied and very helpful with ideas to eateries and attractions and if they are not sure they will find out for you and print maps to here and there if needed. We had a wonderful weekend at The Hyatt Regency and plan to return soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $65 I paid so reported to Priceline!”
Reviews.Author: tamaralea
Reviews.Content: I didn't arrive until midnight and waited outside, but no valet came. A temporary 6 foot wood-grained formica desk was set up just inside the door for check-in. He said he didn't know where the valet worker was, but I could save $4 by parking across the street. (I'm a woman traveling by myself so this was a poor suggestion). Rooms are built around a courtyard, but it is completely torn up. There are tarps, piles of lumber, discarded concrete pieces, and uncovered escalators in the courtyard. In other words, you will see a giant mess. The room was a little small, but intact. The worst problem here is the bed linens. Have you ever had a cheap sweater that develops little balls of fabric across the surface? The term for this is pilling and that is exactly what the bottom bed sheet was doing. Can you imagine trying to sleep on hundreds, maybe thousands of these little fabric balls? Why would they use such cheap linens? There is no way this rates 4 stars. I love Priceline, but this was not worth $65 to me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place - Good Food, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: katiesftbl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Indianapolis in the downtown area for business and I must say I was pleased. You are greated immediately when you arrive and the customer service is fantastic. They have a check in system where you do not need to go to the front desk if you do not want to. Once in the room the decorations are very nice. I had a great view of the Colts stadium and you are in walking distance of PF Change, a Brewery, steakhouse, and the mall. They do not have a soaker tub which is unfortunate but who really wants to take a bath in a hotel anyway? I ordered room service and the food was divine. They also have 3 onsite restaurants which include a rooftop restaurant the Eagle's Nest which serves dinner from 5pm-10pm. They also have Champs Sports Lounge on the second level that serves coctails and some appetizers, and a breakfast type place called Mugs that has muffins, starbucks and so forth. In the room you have a coffee pot and some nice to go cups, a refrigerator but no micro and a nice desk for those that need to work. The office chair is great and the view is stunning. Overall it was a nice stay, I would definitley come back.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't really ask for more.”
Reviews.Author: NODAK1979
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel room on Priceline for 45 dollars, so no matter what I felt as if I was getting a great deal. I still went in with high expectations though, and I felt they delivered. The pros: - EXCELLENT location. This is basically near anything downtown you're going to want to see...Monument Circle and Circle Centre mall are right there, and Conseco Fieldhouse isn't far away. - Very quiet hotel. Walls and floors are very solid...should have no issue sleeping. - Very courteous staff. I was standing around for 15 seconds trying to figure out where to check in, when somebody came up to me very politely and directed me to a very friendly person who checked me in. They were very accomodating. - Definitely up to standards as far as cleanliness goes. Cons: - The only thing I can think of is that I thought the room may be a bit bigger. It seemed about as big as a Motel 6 type place...but it isn't anything that upset me. I'd definitely recommend it, but try getting it on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: BenMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: When you book online on the hotel's web page, they fail to mention that the hotel is undergoing major renovations that will last for the next four month. Restaurant being relocated and other major changes. Have to wait about 10 minutes for an elevator and forget about turndown service. Apparently it doesn't include taking out the trash or picking up the dirty towels. Speaking of trash I saw lots of trash outside various rooms and it took about 18 hours before they come around to pick it up.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: SaminDC
Reviews.Content: I booked on Priceline, and got an excellent deal; I bid slightly below what I thought Hotwire was offering the room at. The room was really nice, the workout room was good, and it had a heated indoor pool. The bathroom amenities were nice, and it smelled like fruit potpourri. Great location. Parking is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hyatt Service”
Reviews.Author: LyleSF
Reviews.Content: I had no problems with this hotel. The front desk staff and valet service were prompt and courteous. The room appeared to have been recently renovated. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!! Pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: richord
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat concerned that the price was too good to be true for a holiday weekend and a football weekend as well. I had also read some rather negative reviews regarding the Hyatt. However when a military discount I had scouted out on Thursday at another downtown hotel was no longer available on Friday when I had time to make my reservation, I just had to go with the best price for two rooms. The rooms were just what I requested - ajoining. The staff was well above average. They have a great work out area as well as a very nice ,if somewhat small pool. It was just a short indoor walk to the mall and the RCA dome. Subway, McDonalds, The Porch & Starbucks coffee were just a few choices I had for dinning with the grandchildren in our lobby area. The gift shop was open extra hours due to the late start of the football game. My only complaint would be the heat. It was just too too warm in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Not pleased”
Reviews.Author: Murforall
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt for 3 nights for a business trip and right from the start we had problems: CHECK-IN: My husband waited in what he thought was the correct line to check in for about 10 minutes, only to be ignored for that whole time period and then told "You have to go over there, we can't help you here". When he finally found the "right" person to check in with, he found them to be condescending and not that helpful. Then, when we tried to take the luggage cart up to the room, we were literally stopped by an employee (he put his arm out to stop us), who told us that we couldn't take the cart up to the room due to the hotel's insurance policy. After 10 minutes of waiting for a bellman to show up, the employee decides to LOCK our luggage in a room. When we demanded that the door be unlocked so that we could take our luggage off the cart and carry it up to our room ourselves, another employee unlocked the door and brought out someone else's luggage, looked at us like we were bothering her and then said "Did you need something?". THE ROOM: On the first night of our stay, we got a room with two doubles instead of the King bed that we had asked for. One of the beds had small tufts of black hair in the sheets, which to me meant that they weren't changed from the previous person. We were able to change to a King room the second night, and the room was much better, only the bed itself was quite hard and mildly comfortable. When we checked out of the hotel they were nice enough to comp us lunch when they heard of our troubles, although, I hardly doubt that we will stay in this hotel again unless we absolutely have to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice PLace”
Reviews.Author: tomanon33
Reviews.Content: Despite any misgivings about elevators in previous posts, the elevators during the time of my visit were quite efficient. Overall, a pretty decent stay. My wife and I were in town for a wedding and were able to snag a government rate. Here is a breakdown of the visit - CHECK-IN: Quite efficient. A front desk representative met us as we walked in. She was very warm and welcoming. She assisted us as we used the electronic kiosk to check into our rooms. This is an efficient method, however, it adds a bit of sterility to the experience. Perhaps I am old fasion, but I prefer going to the front desk and speaking with a representative. It seems more personal. LOBBY/BUILDING APPERANCE: The hotel seems to fall in line with the building spree Hyatt hotels had in the 80's and early 90's. While it was clean and asthetically pleasing, it did convey a sense of that era. I found it to be overall comfortable. ROOM: My wife and I reserved a King room. Overall, the room was very clean and utilitarian. I believe this hotel underwent a recent renovation and the rooms reflected such. Very warm and modern style. The bed would be my only complaint. While large, it was not as comfortable as I would expect. I had difficulty sleeping both nights of my stay. It seemed overly hard and non-form fitting. SERVICE: Service was very professional. If I or my wife had a request, we simply called the "perfect stay" hotline and the issue/need was attended to. They answer the phone by addressing you as Mr. "LASTNAME." It might not seem like a lot, but to me was a nice touch. The only complaint I would have was a less-than-stellar room service experience. I ordered a cobb salad for a late-night meal. There seemed to be a bit of a delay in providing the meal (40-50 meal). My wife ordered a piece of pie (which was "intoxicating" apparently). My salad was decent with the exception that the chicken was very undercooked. Saving myself to have to deal with calling the kitchen again, I simply ate around and attempted to salvage what was left. OTHER: I have to make a special note about the gym. FANTASTIC. I was really impressed with this amenity; all the equipment was new and very user friendly. Hyatt really made a great effort with this property and this guest very much enjoyed it. OVERALL: I would return to the Hyatt Indianapolis. It is located in a great part of downtown (connected to RCA Dome; Circle City Mall, etc). The trip was enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel borders between above average and excellent.”
Reviews.Author: idclaire
Reviews.Content: This hotel borders between above average and excellent. The hotel lobby is beautiful. Especially at night when the luminaries are on in the upper part of the lobby. The elevators are very quick with hardly any waiting. A beautiful waterfall right next to the elevator is part of the view as you go up because they are all glass. There is a revolving restaurant on the very top, although we did not go there while we stayed. It is business casual attire and we only brought jeans with us because we attended the RibAmerica Fest and the drag races over Labor Day weekend. RibAmerica fest was about a 8-10 minute walk. There's a TJ Maxx next door as well as other shopping. Lots of good restaurants near by. The rooms were very spacious, the bed was awesome (king size with 6 of the fluffiest pillows I've ever laid my head on). They also wrap the blankets in sheets so you don't have the "ick" factor from the people who stayed there before. A lot of hotels don't do that. We also had ordered a smoking room, but they didn't have any available. So to compensate for that, we were brought up 4 beers and a tray full of fruits, cheeses, and crackers as complimentary. The lady at the desk acted genuinely sorry that she could not accomodate the smoking room. We were delivered a newspaper the next morning also. The only complaint that I had during the entire stay was in the Champs lounge. The waitress knew we wanted to order from the menu and then she never came back to our table. After sitting there for about 1/2 hour, we just went to the bar, paid for our drinks that she had brought, and went to a restaurant down the street called "Rock Bottom" which had excellent food and service. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. One of the nicest!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Three Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SJL74
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Saturday Aug. 12th to the 13th. We booked the night before on Priceline, we put in an offer of $99. and it was immediately accepted. Laura checked us in on Saturday. She was friendly and helpful. The entire hotel was booked except for seven other rooms she said. There was a gaming convention going on and delegates were buying games, playing games near the banquet room in their sci-fi costumes. The last time we stayed at this hotel they had a different convention so I guess this is a good site for such business. Our room was reasonably clean. The beds were clean, room vacuumed, plenty of pillows. The bathroom was somewhat clean. It seemed that the floors had been swept but not washed since they were sticky. They upgraded the countertop to granite and matching granite baseboards. The bath products were a larger size than comes with most hotels. It was enough for two adults and two children to use once and had a lemon-lavender scent. Our room had a refrigerator and a medium-size closet. There was enough storage in the room for our clothes, but only because we were staying one night. Note: there are four elevators. We stayed on the sixteenth floor (I think there are 18 floors) and we waited 1-3 minutes each time we used the elevator. We did not eat at the sports bar, CHAMPS or the restaurant EAGLES NEST but they are conveniently located inside the hotel. The best part of this hotel is that it is connected to Circle Center Mall. Technically, it is faster to just run down a block into the mall entrance, but in case of incliment weather it is convenient to go through the hallway which leads to another hallway which leads to another (that is well-marked) and the maze ends inside the mall. The hotel pool is 4-feet all the way across. It is clean, with plenty room to swim and plenty of clean towels and seating. The jacuzzi fits about 8-10 people. A nice feature is that there are two skylights, one above the pool and one above the jacuzzi. Anyone waiting for an elevator can see into the pool so I guess it gives them something to do while they wait, but I felt a bit like a goldfish at times. The pool is conveniently next to the fitness room. Both share restrooms (which need to be remodeled.) The restrooms have around 30 lockers, a couple showers, too. I used the restroom facilites while I was there and the first stall I went into had no lock on the door. I didn't see anyone else use the womens room and after seeing the site, would prefer to shower in my own room. I think this hotel would be good for business travelers, convention delegates, families or couples that are there to visit the mall, the RCA dome or other nearby attractions. Overall, I would give this hotel a solid three stars. To reach the four star status, I think the bathroom floor should have been washed, and attention paid to decorative detail such as replacing the wallpaper. Nicer lighting in the bathroom, instead of florescent lighting. Larger rooms. That is a four star. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our valet brought our car within 15 minutes during a busy check-out time. ($24 overnight) We did have a pleasant stay and would stay again if we could pay the same fair rate.

Reviews.Title: “The Hyatt was better than previous negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was certainly better than many of the previous reviews. Our King room was spacious and clean. Someone previously stated that the beds weren't comfortable. All I can say is that the Hyatt must have improved on that because our pillow top bed with eight extra pillows was awesome. The view from the rooms are great and there was virtually no noise all night, even with the 4th of July festivities. There is a McDonalds and a Subway located on the lobby, as well as other places to dine. The location is great, as you can walk to many fabulous restaurants. We will certainly be booking here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Indy”
Reviews.Author: mrbeely
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel in downtown Indianapolis, and I have stayed in more than 10 of them. The rooms are clean and have beautiful furnishings. The staff was most attentive, always meeting our requests within a few minutes. In addition to it's convenient location downtown, it's also great to have numerous restaurants in the hotel lobby. BTW, the elevators all worked fine.

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Regency Indianapolis
HotelInfo.Address: 1 South Capitol Avenue, Indianapolis, IN 46204
